Text

THE SUN ALSO RISES

by [Ernest Hemingway]195-ernest hemingway

_ This book is for [_ HADLEY]196-_ hadley _ and for _ [JOHN HADLEY NICANOR]196-_ hadley

" [You]3289-you are all [a lost generation]3290-a lost generation . "[338-middleweight boxing champion of princeton]

--GERTRUDE [STEIN]337-stein _ in conversation _

" [One generation]3291-one generation passeth away , and [another generation]3292-another generation cometh ; but [the earth]3293-the earth abideth forever . . . The sun also ariseth , and the sun goeth down , and hasteth to the place where [he]197-cohn arose . . . The wind goeth toward the south , and turneth about unto [the north]3294-the north ; it whirleth about continually , and the wind returneth again according to [his]197-cohn circuits . . . . [All the rivers]3295-all the rivers run into [the sea]3296-the sea ; yet [the sea]3296-the sea is not full ; unto the place from whence [the rivers]3298-the rivers come , thither [they]3298-the rivers return again . "[338-middleweight boxing champion of princeton]

--_Ecclesiastes _

BOOK I

CHAPTER 1

[Robert Cohn]197-cohn was once [middleweight boxing champion of [Princeton]1-princeton]338-middleweight boxing champion of princeton . Do not think that [I]0-rioja alta am very much impressed by that as a boxing title , but it meant a lot to [Cohn]197-cohn . [He]197-cohn cared nothing for boxing , in fact [he]197-cohn disliked it , but [he]197-cohn learned it painfully and thoroughly to counteract the feeling of inferiority and shyness [he]197-cohn had felt on being treated as [a Jew]339-a jew at [Princeton]1-princeton . There was a certain inner comfort in knowing [he]197-cohn could knock down anybody who was snooty to [him]197-cohn , although , being very shy and [a thoroughly nice boy]340-a thoroughly nice boy , [he]197-cohn never fought except in [the gym]341-the gym . [He]197-cohn was [[Spider Kelly]198-spider kelly 's star pupil]342-spider kelly 's star pupil . [Spider Kelly]198-spider kelly taught all [[his]198-spider kelly young gentlemen]343-his young gentlemen to box like featherweights , no matter whether [they]343-his young gentlemen weighed one hundred and five or two hundred and five pounds . But it seemed to fit [Cohn]197-cohn . [He]197-cohn was really very fast . [He]197-cohn was so good that [Spider]198-spider kelly promptly overmatched [him]197-cohn and got [his]197-cohn nose permanently flattened . This increased [Cohn]197-cohn 's distaste for boxing , but it gave [him]197-cohn a certain satisfaction of some strange sort , and it certainly improved [his]197-cohn nose . In [his]197-cohn last year at [Princeton]1-princeton [he]197-cohn read too much and took to wearing spectacles . [I]0-rioja alta never met [any one of [[his]197-cohn class]345-his class who remembered [him]197-cohn]344-any one of his class who remembered him . [They]344-any one of his class who remembered him did not even remember that [he]197-cohn was [middleweight boxing champion]346-middleweight boxing champion .

[I]0-rioja alta mistrust [all frank and simple people]347-all frank and simple people , especially when [their]347-all frank and simple people stories hold together , and [I]0-rioja alta always had a suspicion that perhaps [Robert Cohn]197-cohn had never been [middleweight boxing champion]346-middleweight boxing champion , and that perhaps a horse had stepped on [his]197-cohn face , or that maybe [[his]197-cohn mother]349-his mother had been frightened or seen something , or that [he]197-cohn had , maybe , bumped into something as [a young child]350-a young child , but [I]0-rioja alta finally had [somebody]351-somebody verify the story from [Spider Kelly]198-spider kelly . [Spider Kelly]198-spider kelly not only remembered [Cohn]197-cohn . [He]198-spider kelly had often wondered what had become of [him]197-cohn .

[Robert Cohn]197-cohn was a member , through [[his]197-cohn father]352-his father , of [one of [the richest Jewish families in [New York]2-new york]354-the richest jewish families in new york]353-one of the richest jewish families in new york , and through [[his]197-cohn mother]349-his mother of [one of [the oldest]357-the oldest]356-one of the oldest . At [the military school where [he]197-cohn prepped for [Princeton]1-princeton]358-the military school where he prepped for princeton , and played a very good end on [the football team]359-the football team , [no one]360-no one had made [him]197-cohn race - conscious . [No one]360-no one had ever made [him]197-cohn feel [he]197-cohn was [a Jew]339-a jew , and hence any different from [anybody else]363-anybody else , until [he]197-cohn went to [Princeton]1-princeton . [He]197-cohn was [a nice boy]364-a nice boy , [a friendly boy]365-a friendly boy , and very shy , and it made [him]197-cohn bitter . [He]197-cohn took it out in boxing , and [he]197-cohn came out of [Princeton]1-princeton with painful self - consciousness and the flattened nose , and was married by [the first girl who was nice to [him]197-cohn]366-the first girl who was nice to him . [He]197-cohn was married five years , had [three children]367-three children , lost most of the fifty thousand dollars [[his]197-cohn father]352-his father left [him]197-cohn , the balance of [the estate]369-the estate having gone to [[his]197-cohn mother]349-his mother , hardened into a rather unattractive mould under domestic unhappiness with [a rich wife]371-a rich wife ; and just when [he]197-cohn had made up [his]197-cohn mind to leave [[his]197-cohn wife]372-his wife [she]372-his wife left [him]197-cohn and went off with [a miniature - painter]373-a miniature - painter . As [he]197-cohn had been thinking for months about leaving [[his]197-cohn wife]372-his wife and had not done it because it would be too cruel to deprive [her]372-his wife of [himself]197-cohn , [her]372-his wife departure was a very healthful shock .

The divorce was arranged and [Robert Cohn]197-cohn went out to [the Coast]3-the coast . In [California]4-california [he]197-cohn fell among [literary people]375-literary people and , as [he]197-cohn still had a little of the fifty thousand left , in a short time [he]197-cohn was backing a review of the Arts . The review commenced publication in [Carmel]5-carmel , [California]4-california , and finished in [Provincetown]6-provincetown , [Massachusetts]7-massachusetts . By that time [Cohn]197-cohn , who had been regarded purely as [an angel , and whose name had appeared on the editorial page merely as a member of the advisory board]376-an angel , and whose name had appeared on the editorial page merely as a member of the advisory board , had become [the sole editor]377-the sole editor . It was [his]197-cohn money and [he]197-cohn discovered [he]197-cohn liked the authority of editing . [He]197-cohn was sorry when the magazine became too expensive and [he]197-cohn had to give it up .

By that time , though , [he]197-cohn had other things to worry about . [He]197-cohn had been taken in hand by [a lady who hoped to rise with the magazine]378-a lady who hoped to rise with the magazine . [She]378-a lady who hoped to rise with the magazine was very forceful , and [Cohn]197-cohn never had a chance of not being taken in hand . Also [he]197-cohn was sure that [he]197-cohn loved [her]378-a lady who hoped to rise with the magazine . When [this lady]379-this lady saw that the magazine was not going to rise , [she]379-this lady became a little disgusted with [Cohn]197-cohn and decided that [she]379-this lady might as well get what there was to get while there was still something available , so [she]379-this lady urged that [they]380-they go to [Europe]8-europe , where [Cohn]197-cohn could write . [They]380-they came to [Europe]8-europe , where [the lady]381-the lady had been educated , and stayed three years . During these three years , the first spent in travel , the last two in [Paris]9-paris , [Robert Cohn]197-cohn had [two friends]382-two friends , [Braddocks]199-mrs. braddocks and [myself]0-rioja alta . [Braddocks]199-mrs. braddocks was [[his]197-cohn literary friend]383-his literary friend . [I]0-rioja alta was [[his]197-cohn tennis friend]384-his tennis friend .

[The lady who had [him]197-cohn]385-the lady who had him , [her]385-the lady who had him name was [Frances]200-frances , found toward the end of the second year that [her]385-the lady who had him looks were going , and [her]385-the lady who had him attitude toward [Robert]197-cohn changed from one of careless possession and exploitation to the absolute determination that [he]197-cohn should marry [her]385-the lady who had him . During this time [[Robert]197-cohn 's mother]386-robert 's mother had settled an allowance on [him]197-cohn , about three hundred dollars a month . During two years and a half [I]0-rioja alta do not believe that [Robert Cohn]197-cohn looked at [another woman]387-another woman . [He]197-cohn was fairly happy , except that , like [many people living in [Europe]8-europe]388-many people living in europe , [he]197-cohn would rather have been in [America]10-america , and [he]197-cohn had discovered writing . [He]197-cohn wrote a novel , and it was not really such a bad novel as [the critics]389-the critics later called it , although it was a very poor novel . [He]197-cohn read many books , played bridge , played tennis , and boxed at [a local gymnasium]390-a local gymnasium .

[I]0-rioja alta first became aware of [[his]197-cohn lady]391-his lady 's attitude toward [him]197-cohn one night after the three of [us]392-us had dined together . [We]392-us had dined at [l'Avenue 's]393-l'avenue 's and afterward went to [the Caf de Versailles]11-the caf de versailles for coffee . [We]392-us had several _ fines _ after the coffee , and [I]0-rioja alta said [I]0-rioja alta must be going . [Cohn]197-cohn had been talking about the two of [us]392-us going off somewhere on a weekend trip . [He]197-cohn wanted to get out of [town]394-town and get in a good walk . [I]0-rioja alta suggested [we]392-us fly to [Strasbourg]12-strasbourg and walk up to [Saint Odile]13-saint odile , or somewhere or other in [Alsace]14-alsace . " [I]0-rioja alta know [a girl in [Strasbourg]12-strasbourg who can show [us]392-us [the town]3300-the town]3299-a girl in strasbourg who can show us the town , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said .

[Somebody]351-somebody kicked [me]0-rioja alta under the table . [I]0-rioja alta thought it was accidental and went on : " [She]3299-a girl in strasbourg who can show us the town 's been there two years and knows everything there is to know about [the town]3300-the town . [She]3299-a girl in strasbourg who can show us the town 's [a swell girl]3302-a swell girl . "[0-rioja alta]

[I]0-rioja alta was kicked again under the table and , looking , saw [Frances]200-frances , [[Robert]197-cohn 's lady]396-robert 's lady , [her]200-frances chin lifting and [her]200-frances face hardening .

" Hell , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said , " why go to [Strasbourg]12-strasbourg ? [We]3303-we could go up to [Bruges]15-bruges , or to [the Ardennes]16-the ardennes . "[0-rioja alta]

[Cohn]197-cohn looked relieved . [I]0-rioja alta was not kicked again . [I]0-rioja alta said good - night and went out . [Cohn]197-cohn said [he]197-cohn wanted to buy a paper and would walk to the corner with [me]0-rioja alta . " For [God]201-god 's sake , "[197-cohn] [he]197-cohn said , " why did [you]0-rioja alta say that about [that girl in [Strasbourg]12-strasbourg]3304-that girl in strasbourg for ? Did n't [you]0-rioja alta see [Frances]200-frances ? "[197-cohn]

" No , why should [I]197-cohn ? If [I]197-cohn know [an American girl that lives in [Strasbourg]12-strasbourg]3305-an american girl that lives in strasbourg what the hell is it to [Frances]200-frances ? "[197-cohn]

" It does n't make any difference . [Any girl]3306-any girl . [I]197-cohn could n't go , that would be all . "[197-cohn]

" Do n't be silly . "[197-cohn]

" [You]0-rioja alta do n't know [Frances]200-frances . [Any girl]3306-any girl at all . Did n't [you]0-rioja alta see the way [she]200-frances looked ? "[197-cohn]

" Oh , well , "[197-cohn] [I]0-rioja alta said , " let 's go to [Senlis]17-senlis . "[197-cohn]

" Do n't get sore . "[197-cohn]

" [I]197-cohn 'm not sore . [Senlis]17-senlis is [a good place]3308-a good place and [we]3309-we can stay at [the Grand Cerf]3310-the grand cerf and take a hike in [the woods]3311-the woods and come [home]3312-home . "[197-cohn]

" Good , that will be fine . "[197-cohn]

" No , why should [I]401-i be ? "[401-i]

CHAPTER 2

That winter [Robert Cohn]197-cohn went over to [America]10-america with [his]197-cohn novel , and it was accepted by [a fairly good publisher]402-a fairly good publisher . [His]197-cohn going made an awful row [I]0-rioja alta heard , and [I]0-rioja alta think that was where [Frances]200-frances lost [him]197-cohn , because [several women]403-several women were nice to [him]197-cohn in [New York]2-new york , and when [he]197-cohn came back [he]197-cohn was quite changed . [He]197-cohn was more enthusiastic about [America]10-america than ever , and [he]197-cohn was not so simple , and [he]197-cohn was not so nice . [The publishers]404-the publishers had praised [his]197-cohn novel pretty highly and it rather went to [his]197-cohn head . Then [several women]403-several women had put [themselves]403-several women out to be nice to [him]197-cohn , and [his]197-cohn horizons had all shifted . For four years [his]197-cohn horizon had been absolutely limited to [[his]197-cohn wife]372-his wife . For three years , or almost three years , [he]197-cohn had never seen beyond [Frances]200-frances . [I]0-rioja alta am sure [he]197-cohn had never been in love in [his]197-cohn life .

[He]197-cohn had married on the rebound from the rotten time [he]197-cohn had in college , and [Frances]200-frances took [him]197-cohn on the rebound from [his]197-cohn discovery that [he]197-cohn had not been everything to [[his]197-cohn first wife]407-his first wife . [He]197-cohn was not in love yet but [he]197-cohn realized that [he]197-cohn was an attractive quantity to [women]408-women , and that the fact of [a woman]409-a woman caring for [him]197-cohn and wanting to live with [him]197-cohn was not simply a divine miracle . This changed [him]197-cohn so that [he]197-cohn was not so pleasant to have around . Also , playing for higher stakes than [he]197-cohn could afford in some rather steep bridge games with [his]197-cohn [New York]2-new york connections , [he]197-cohn had held cards and won several hundred dollars . It made [him]197-cohn rather vain of [his]197-cohn bridge game , and [he]197-cohn talked several times of how [a man]410-a man could always make a living at bridge if [he]410-a man were ever forced to .

Then there was another thing . [He]197-cohn had been reading [W. H. Hudson]203-w. h. hudson . That sounds like an innocent occupation , but [Cohn]197-cohn had read and reread " [The Purple Land]18-the purple land . "[197-cohn] " The Purple Land "[197-cohn] is a very sinister book if read too late in life . It recounts splendid imaginary amorous adventures of [a perfect English gentleman]411-a perfect english gentleman in [an intensely romantic land]412-an intensely romantic land , the scenery of which is very well described . For [a man]410-a man to take it at thirty - four as a guide - book to what life holds is about as safe as it would be for [a man of the same age]414-a man of the same age to enter [Wall Street]19-wall street direct from [a French convent]415-a french convent , equipped with a complete set of the more practical Alger books . [Cohn]197-cohn , [I]0-rioja alta believe , took every word of " [The Purple Land]18-the purple land "[197-cohn] as literally as though it had been an R. G. Dun report . [You]416-you understand [me]0-rioja alta , [he]197-cohn made some reservations , but on the whole the book to [him]197-cohn was sound . It was all that was needed to set [him]197-cohn off . [I]0-rioja alta did not realize the extent to which it had set [him]197-cohn off until one day [he]197-cohn came into [[my]0-rioja alta office]417-my office .

" Hello , [Robert]197-cohn , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " Did [you]197-cohn come in to cheer [me]0-rioja alta up ? "[0-rioja alta]

" Would [you]197-cohn like to go to [South America]22-south america , [Jake]202-jake ? "[197-cohn] [he]197-cohn asked .

" No . "[0-rioja alta]

" Why not ? "[197-cohn]

" [I]0-rioja alta do n't know . [I]0-rioja alta never wanted to go . Too expensive . [You]197-cohn can see all the South Americans [you]197-cohn want in [Paris]9-paris anyway . "[0-rioja alta]

" [They]3314-they 're not the real [South Americans]21-south americans . "[197-cohn]

" [They]3314-they look awfully real to [me]0-rioja alta . "[0-rioja alta]

[I]0-rioja alta had [a boat train to catch]418-a boat train to catch with a week 's mail stories , and only half of them written .

" Do [you]197-cohn know any dirt ? "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta asked .

" No . "[197-cohn]

" None of [[your]197-cohn exalted connections]3315-your exalted connections getting divorces ? "[197-cohn]

" No ; listen , [Jake]202-jake . If [I]197-cohn handled both [our]3316-our expenses , would [you]202-jake go to [South America]22-south america with [me]197-cohn ? "[197-cohn]

" Why [me]197-cohn ? "[197-cohn]

" [You]197-cohn can talk Spanish . And it would be more fun with [two of [us]3316-our]3317-two of us . "[197-cohn]

" No , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said , " [I]0-rioja alta like [[this town]3318-this town]3318-this town and [I]0-rioja alta go to [Spain]23-spain in the summer - time . "[0-rioja alta]

" All [my]197-cohn life [I]197-cohn 've wanted to go on a trip like that , "[197-cohn] [Cohn]197-cohn said . [He]197-cohn sat down . " [I]197-cohn 'll be too old before [I]197-cohn can ever do it . "[197-cohn]

" Do n't be [a fool]3320-a fool , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " [You]197-cohn can go anywhere [you]197-cohn want . [You]197-cohn 've got plenty of money . "[0-rioja alta]

" [I]197-cohn know . But [I]197-cohn ca n't get started . "[197-cohn]

" Cheer up , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " [All countries]3321-all countries look just like the moving pictures . "[0-rioja alta]

But [I]0-rioja alta felt sorry for [him]197-cohn . [He]197-cohn had it badly .

It is awfully easy to be hard - boiled about everything in the daytime , but at night it is another thing .

CHAPTER 5

In the morning [I]0-rioja alta walked down [the Boulevard]58-the boulevard to [the rue Soufflot]59-the rue soufflot for coffee and brioche . It was a fine morning . The horse - chestnut trees in [the Luxembourg gardens]684-the luxembourg gardens were in bloom . There was the pleasant early - morning feeling of a hot day . [I]0-rioja alta read the papers with the coffee and then smoked a cigarette . [The flower - women]685-the flower - women were coming up from [the market]686-the market and arranging [their]685-the flower - women daily stock . [Students]687-students went by going up to [the law school]688-the law school , or down to [the Sorbonne]60-the sorbonne . [The Boulevard]439-the boulevard was busy with [trams]690-trams and [people]484-people going to work . [I]0-rioja alta got on [an S bus]692-an s bus and rode down to [the Madeleine]693-the madeleine , standing on [the back platform]694-the back platform . From [the Madeleine]693-the madeleine [I]0-rioja alta walked along [the Boulevard des Capucines]696-the boulevard des capucines to [the Op ra]697-the op ra , and up to [[my]0-rioja alta office]417-my office . [I]0-rioja alta passed [the man with the jumping frogs]699-the man with the jumping frogs and [the man with the boxer toys]700-the man with the boxer toys . [I]0-rioja alta stepped aside to avoid walking into the thread with which [[his]699-the man with the jumping frogs girl assistant]701-his girl assistant manipulated the boxers . [She]701-his girl assistant was standing looking away , the thread in [her]701-his girl assistant folded hands . [The man]702-the man was urging [two tourists]703-two tourists to buy . [Three more tourists]704-three more tourists had stopped and were watching . [I]0-rioja alta walked on behind [a man who was pushing a roller that printed the name CINZANO on [the sidewalk]615-the sidewalk]705-a man who was pushing a roller that printed the name cinzano on the sidewalk in damp letters . All along [people]484-people were going to work . It felt pleasant to be going to work . [I]0-rioja alta walked across [the avenue]459-the avenue and turned in to [[my]0-rioja alta office]417-my office .

Up - stairs in [the office]3340-the office [I]0-rioja alta read the French morning papers , smoked , and then sat at the typewriter and got off a good morning 's work . The sort of healthy conceit that [he]231-harvey had when [he]231-harvey returned from [America]10-america early in the spring was gone . Then [he]231-harvey had been sure of [his]231-harvey work , only with these personal longings for adventure . Now the sureness was gone . Somehow [I]0-rioja alta feel [I]0-rioja alta have not shown [Robert Cohn]197-cohn clearly . The reason is that until [he]231-harvey fell in love with [Brett]212-brett , [I]0-rioja alta never heard [him]231-harvey make one remark that would , in any way , detach [him]231-harvey from [other people]769-other people . [He]231-harvey was nice to watch on [the tennis - court]770-the tennis - court , [he]231-harvey had a good body , and [he]231-harvey kept it in shape ; [he]231-harvey handled [his]231-harvey cards well at [bridge]771-bridge , and [he]231-harvey had a funny sort of undergraduate quality about [him]231-harvey . [He]231-harvey wore what used to be called polo shirts at [school]772-school , and may be called that still , but [he]231-harvey was not professionally youthful . [I]0-rioja alta do not believe [he]231-harvey thought about [his]231-harvey clothes much . Externally [he]231-harvey had been formed at [Princeton]1-princeton . [He]231-harvey had a nice , boyish sort of cheerfulness that had never been trained out of [him]231-harvey , and [I]0-rioja alta probably have not brought it out . [He]231-harvey loved to win at tennis . [He]231-harvey probably loved to win as much as [Lenglen]234-lenglen , for instance . On the other hand , [he]231-harvey was not angry at being beaten . [He]231-harvey was very nice about it .

CHAPTER 7

" [I]625-the concierge do n't know . [He]3578-a friend of mine was never [here]3364-here before . [He]3578-a friend of mine was very large . Very , very large . [She]625-the concierge was very nice . BOOK II

CHAPTER 8

[I]0-rioja alta did not see [Brett]212-brett again until [she]212-brett came back from [San Sebastian]78-san sebastian . One card came from [her]212-brett from [there]3333-there . [Brett]212-brett was gone , [I]0-rioja alta was not bothered by [Cohn]197-cohn 's troubles , [I]0-rioja alta rather enjoyed not having to play tennis , there was plenty of work to do , [I]0-rioja alta went often to the races , dined with [friends]424-friends , and put in some extra time at [the office]3340-the office getting things ahead so [I]0-rioja alta could leave it in charge of [[my]0-rioja alta secretary]924-my secretary when [Bill Gorton]240-bill and [I]0-rioja alta should shove off to [Spain]23-spain the end of June . " Where will [we]935-we go ? "[939-two men in flowing robes]

CHAPTER 9

[The Ledoux - Kid Francis]1022-the ledoux - kid francis fight was the night of the 20th of June . It was a good fight . The morning after the fight [I]0-rioja alta had a letter from [Robert Cohn]197-cohn , written from [Hendaye]256-hendaye . [He]197-cohn was having a very quiet time , [he]197-cohn said , bathing , playing some golf and much bridge . [Hendaye]256-hendaye had [a splendid beach]1023-a splendid beach , but [he]197-cohn was anxious to start on the fishing - trip . When would [I]0-rioja alta be down ? If [I]0-rioja alta would buy [him]197-cohn a double - tapered line [he]197-cohn would pay [me]0-rioja alta when [I]0-rioja alta came down .

[We]1084-we got into [the cab]460-the cab , and [the cabman]1112-the cabman put the bags up on the seat beside [him]1112-the cabman and climbed up and cracked [his]1112-the cabman whip , and [we]1084-we drove over [the dark bridge]1113-the dark bridge and into [the town]3300-the town .

" [I]197-cohn 'm awfully glad to meet [you]240-bill , "[197-cohn] [Robert]197-cohn said to [Bill]240-bill . " [I]197-cohn 've heard so much about [you]240-bill from [Jake]202-jake and [I]197-cohn 've read [your]240-bill books . Did [you]240-bill get [my]197-cohn line , [Jake]202-jake ? "[197-cohn]

[The cab]460-the cab stopped in front of [the hotel]913-the hotel and [we]1084-we all got out and went in . It was [a nice hotel]1117-a nice hotel , and [the people at the desk]1118-the people at the desk were very cheerful , and [we]1084-we each had [a good small room]1119-a good small room .

CHAPTER 10

In the morning it was bright , and [they]1120-they were sprinkling [the streets of [the town]3300-the town]1121-the streets of the town , and [we]1084-we all had breakfast in [a caf]1123-a caf . [Bayonne]101-bayonne is [a nice town]1124-a nice town . [It]101-bayonne is like [a very clean Spanish town]1125-a very clean spanish town and [it]101-bayonne is on [a big river]1126-a big river . Already , so early in the morning , it was very hot on [the bridge across [the river]3357-the river]1127-the bridge across the river . [We]1084-we walked out on [the bridge]743-the bridge and then took a walk through [the town]3300-the town .

[I]0-rioja alta was not at all sure [Mike]219-mike 's rods would come from [Scotland]64-scotland in time , so [we]1084-we hunted [a tackle store]1131-a tackle store and finally bought a rod for Bill up - stairs over [a drygoods store]1132-a drygoods store . [The man who sold the tackle]1133-the man who sold the tackle was out , and [we]1084-we had to wait for [him]1133-the man who sold the tackle to come back . Finally [he]1133-the man who sold the tackle came in , and [we]1084-we bought a pretty good rod cheap , and two landing - nets .

[We]1084-we went out into [the street]445-the street again and took a look at [the cathedral]1135-the cathedral . [Cohn]197-cohn made some remark about [it]1135-the cathedral being a very good example of something or other , [I]0-rioja alta forget what . [It]1135-the cathedral seemed like [a nice cathedral]1136-a nice cathedral , nice and dim , like [Spanish churches]1137-spanish churches . Then [we]1084-we went up past [the old fort]1138-the old fort and out to [the local Syndicat d'Initiative office]1139-the local syndicat d'initiative office , where [the bus]1140-the bus was supposed to start from . There [they]1139-the local syndicat d'initiative office told [us]1084-we [the bus]1140-the bus service did not start until the 1st of July . [We]1084-we found out at [the tourist office]1142-the tourist office what [we]1084-we ought to pay for [a motor - car]1143-a motor - car to [Pamplona]81-pamplona and hired one at [a big garage just around the corner from [the Municipal Theatre]113-the municipal theatre]1144-a big garage just around the corner from the municipal theatre for four hundred francs . [The car]581-the car was to pick [us]1084-we up at [the hotel]913-the hotel in forty minutes , and [we]1084-we stopped at [the caf on [the square]995-the square]1147-the caf on the square where [we]1084-we had eaten breakfast , and had a beer . It was hot , but [the town]3300-the town had a cool , fresh , early - morning smell and it was pleasant sitting in [the caf]398-the caf . A breeze started to blow , and [you]1151-you could feel that the air came from [the sea]3296-the sea . There were pigeons out in [the square]995-the square , and [the houses]981-the houses were a yellow , sun - baked color , and [I]0-rioja alta did not want to leave [the caf]398-the caf . But [we]1084-we had to go to [the hotel]913-the hotel to get [our]1084-we bags packed and pay the bill . [We]1084-we paid for the beers , [we]1084-we matched and [I]0-rioja alta think [Cohn]197-cohn paid , and went up to [the hotel]913-the hotel . It was only sixteen francs apiece for [Bill]240-bill and [me]0-rioja alta , with ten per cent added for the service , and [we]1084-we had the bags sent down and waited for [Robert Cohn]197-cohn . While [we]1084-we were waiting [I]0-rioja alta saw a cockroach on the parquet floor that must have been at least three inches long . [I]0-rioja alta pointed [him]1158-him out to [Bill]240-bill and then put [my]0-rioja alta shoe on [him]1158-him . [We]1084-we agreed [he]1158-him must have just come in from [the garden]1159-the garden . It was really [an awfully clean hotel]1160-an awfully clean hotel .

[Cohn]197-cohn came down , finally , and [we]1084-we all went out to [the car]581-the car . It was [a big , closed car]1162-a big , closed car , with [a driver in a white duster with blue collar and cuffs]1163-a driver in a white duster with blue collar and cuffs , and [we]1084-we had [him]1163-a driver in a white duster with blue collar and cuffs put the back of [the car]581-the car down . [He]1163-a driver in a white duster with blue collar and cuffs piled in the bags and [we]1084-we started off up [the street]445-the street and out of [the town]3300-the town . [We]1084-we passed [some lovely gardens]1167-some lovely gardens and had a good look back at [the town]3300-the town , and then [we]1084-we were out in [the country]3325-the country , green and rolling , and [the road]1170-the road climbing all the time . [We]1084-we passed lots of Basques with [oxen]1171-oxen , or cattle , hauling carts along [the road]1170-the road , and [nice farmhouses]1173-nice farmhouses , low roofs , and all white - plastered . In [the Basque country]1174-the basque country the land all looks very rich and green and [the houses]981-the houses and [villages]1176-villages look well - off and clean . [Every village]1177-every village had [a pelota court]1178-a pelota court and on some of them [kids]3473-kids were playing in the hot sun . [You]1188-you could n't see [the sea]3296-the sea . It was too far away . [We]1084-we crossed [the Spanish frontier]1192-the spanish frontier . There was [a little stream]1193-a little stream and [a bridge]1194-a bridge , and [Spanish carabineers]1195-spanish carabineers , with patent - leather Bonaparte hats , and short guns on [their]1195-spanish carabineers backs , on one side , and on the other fat Frenchmen in kepis and mustaches . [They]1195-spanish carabineers only opened one bag and took the passports in and looked at [them]1195-spanish carabineers . [The chauffeur]720-the chauffeur had to go in and fill out some papers about [the car]581-the car and [we]1084-we got out and went over to [the stream]1199-the stream to see if there were any trout . [Bill]240-bill tried to talk [some Spanish]1200-some spanish to [one of [the carabineers]1202-the carabineers]1201-one of the carabineers , but it did not go very well . [We]1214-we came down out of [the mountains]1027-the mountains and through [an oak forest]1227-an oak forest , and there were white cattle grazing in [the forest]1228-the forest . [I]0-rioja alta was up in front with [the driver]454-the driver and [I]0-rioja alta turned around . [Robert Cohn]197-cohn was asleep , but [Bill]240-bill looked and nodded [his]240-bill head . [We]1214-we came into [the town]3300-the town on [the other side of [the plateau]1250-the plateau]1256-the other side of the plateau , the road slanting up steeply and dustily with shade - trees on both sides , and then levelling out through [the new part of [town]394-town]1258-the new part of town [they]1260-they are building up outside the old walls . [I]0-rioja alta went to [the Ayuntamiento]117-the ayuntamiento and found [the old gentleman who subscribes for the bull - fight tickets for [me]0-rioja alta every year]1301-the old gentleman who subscribes for the bull - fight tickets for me every year , and [he]1301-the old gentleman who subscribes for the bull - fight tickets for me every year had gotten the money [I]0-rioja alta sent [him]1301-the old gentleman who subscribes for the bull - fight tickets for me every year from [Paris]9-paris and renewed [my]0-rioja alta subscriptions , so that was all set . " [You]0-rioja alta must have been in [a motor - car]1143-a motor - car , "[1308-the porter] [he]1308-the porter said .

" From [Bayonne]101-bayonne . "[1308-the porter]

At the end of [the street]445-the street [I]0-rioja alta saw [the cathedral]1135-the cathedral and walked up toward [it]1135-the cathedral . The first time [I]0-rioja alta ever saw it [I]0-rioja alta thought the fa ade was ugly but [I]0-rioja alta liked it now . [I]0-rioja alta went inside . [It]1311-it was dim and dark and the pillars went high up , and there were [people]484-people praying , and it smelt of incense , and there were some wonderful big windows . [I]0-rioja alta knelt and started to pray and prayed for [everybody]3344-everybody [I]0-rioja alta thought of , [Brett]212-brett and [Mike]219-mike and [Bill]240-bill and [Robert Cohn]197-cohn and [myself]0-rioja alta , and [all the bull - fighters]1314-all the bull - fighters , separately for the ones [I]0-rioja alta liked , and lumping all the rest , then [I]0-rioja alta prayed for [myself]0-rioja alta again , and while [I]0-rioja alta was praying for [myself]0-rioja alta [I]0-rioja alta found [I]0-rioja alta was getting sleepy , so [I]0-rioja alta prayed that the bull - fights would be good , and that it would be a fine fiesta , and that [we]1315-we would get some fishing . [I]0-rioja alta wondered if there was anything else [I]0-rioja alta might pray for , and [I]0-rioja alta thought [I]0-rioja alta would like to have some money , so [I]0-rioja alta prayed that [I]0-rioja alta would make a lot of money , and then [I]0-rioja alta started to think how [I]0-rioja alta would make it , and thinking of making money reminded [me]0-rioja alta of [the count]612-the count , and [I]0-rioja alta started wondering about where [he]612-the count was , and regretting [I]0-rioja alta had n't seen [him]612-the count since that night in [Montmartre]32-montmartre , and about something funny [Brett]212-brett told [me]0-rioja alta about [him]612-the count , and as all the time [I]0-rioja alta was kneeling with [my]0-rioja alta forehead on the wood in front of [me]0-rioja alta , and was thinking of [myself]0-rioja alta as praying , [I]0-rioja alta was a little ashamed , and regretted that [I]0-rioja alta was such [a rotten Catholic]1317-a rotten catholic , but realized there was nothing [I]0-rioja alta could do about it , at least for a while , and maybe never , but that anyway it was a grand religion , and [I]0-rioja alta only wished [I]0-rioja alta felt religious and maybe [I]0-rioja alta would the next time ; and then [I]0-rioja alta was out in the hot sun on the steps of [the cathedral]1135-the cathedral , and the forefingers and the thumb of [my]0-rioja alta right hand were still damp , and [I]0-rioja alta felt them dry in the sun . The sunlight was hot and hard , and [I]0-rioja alta crossed over beside [some buildings]1319-some buildings , and walked back along [side - streets]1320-side - streets to [the hotel]913-the hotel .

At dinner that night [we]1322-we found that [Robert Cohn]197-cohn had taken a bath , had had a shave and a haircut and a shampoo , and something put on [his]197-cohn hair afterward to make it stay down . [He]197-cohn was nervous , and [I]0-rioja alta did not try to help [him]197-cohn any . [The train]1035-the train was due in at nine o'clock from [San Sebastian]78-san sebastian , and , if [Brett]212-brett and [Mike]219-mike were coming , [they]1324-they would be on it . At twenty minutes to nine [we]1322-we were not half through dinner . [Robert Cohn]197-cohn got up from the table and said [he]197-cohn would go to [the station]1093-the station . CHAPTER 11

It was baking hot in [the square]995-the square when [we]1364-our came out after lunch with [our]1364-our bags and the rod - case to go to [Burguete]105-burguete . [People]484-people were on top of [the bus]1140-the bus , and [others]1367-others were climbing up a ladder . [Bill]240-bill went up and [Robert]197-cohn sat beside [Bill]240-bill to save [a place for [me]0-rioja alta]1368-a place for me , and [I]0-rioja alta went back in [the hotel]913-the hotel to get a couple of bottles of wine to take with [us]1364-our . When [I]0-rioja alta came out [the bus]1140-the bus was crowded . [Men]580-men and [women]408-women were sitting on all the baggage and boxes on top , and [the women]1373-the women all had [[their]1373-the women fans]1374-their fans going in the sun . It certainly was hot . [Robert]197-cohn climbed down and [I]0-rioja alta fitted into [the place [he]197-cohn had saved on the one wooden seat that ran across the top]1375-the place he had saved on the one wooden seat that ran across the top .

[Robert Cohn]197-cohn stood in the shade of [the arcade]1288-the arcade waiting for [us]1364-our start . [A Basque]261-a basque with a big leather wine - bag in [his]261-a basque lap lay across the top of [the bus]1140-the bus in front of [our]1364-our seat , leaning back against [our]1364-our legs . [He]261-a basque offered the wine - skin to [Bill]240-bill and to [me]0-rioja alta , and when [I]0-rioja alta tipped it up to drink [he]261-a basque imitated the sound of a klaxon motor - horn so well and so suddenly that [I]0-rioja alta spilled some of the wine , and [everybody]3344-everybody laughed . [He]261-a basque apologized and made [me]0-rioja alta take another drink . [He]261-a basque made the klaxon again a little later , and it fooled [me]0-rioja alta the second time . [He]261-a basque was very good at it . [The Basques]262-the basques liked it . [The man next to [Bill]240-bill]1379-the man next to bill was talking to [him]240-bill in Spanish and [Bill]240-bill was not getting it , so [he]240-bill offered [the man]702-the man one of the bottles of wine . [The man]702-the man waved it away . [He]702-the man said it was too hot and [he]702-the man had drunk too much at lunch . When [Bill]240-bill offered the bottle the second time [he]240-bill took a long drink , and then the bottle went all over that part of [the bus]1140-the bus . [Every one]505-every one took a drink very politely , and then [they]505-every one made [us]1384-us cork it up and put it away . [They]505-every one all wanted [us]1384-us to drink from [their]505-every one leather wine - bottles . [They]505-every one were peasants going up into [the hills]1385-the hills .

Finally , after a couple more false klaxons , [the bus]1140-the bus started , and [Robert Cohn]197-cohn waved good - by to [us]1384-us , and [all the Basques]1387-all the basques waved good - by to [him]197-cohn . As soon as [we]1384-us started out on [the road outside of [town]394-town]1388-the road outside of town it was cool . It felt nice riding high up and close under the trees . [The bus]1140-the bus went quite fast and made a good breeze , and as [we]1384-us went out along [the road]1170-the road with the dust powdering the trees and down [the hill]567-the hill , [we]1384-us had a fine view , back through the trees , of [the town]3300-the town rising up from [the bluff above [the river]3357-the river]1394-the bluff above the river . [The Basque]1396-the basque lying against [my]0-rioja alta knees pointed out the view with the neck of the wine - bottle , and winked at [us]1384-us . [He]1396-the basque nodded [his]1396-the basque head .

" Pretty nice , eh ? "[1396-the basque]

" [These Basques]3914-these basques are [swell people]3915-swell people , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

[The Basque]1396-the basque lying against [my]0-rioja alta legs was tanned the color of saddle - leather . [He]1396-the basque wore a black smock like all the rest . There were wrinkles in [his]1396-the basque tanned neck . [He]1396-the basque turned around and offered [his]1396-the basque wine - bag to [Bill]240-bill . [Bill]240-bill handed [him]1396-the basque one of [our]1384-us bottles . [The Basque]1396-the basque wagged a forefinger at [him]1396-the basque and handed the bottle back , slapping in the cork with the palm of [his]1396-the basque hand . [He]1396-the basque shoved the wine - bag up .

" [Arriba]263-arriba ! [Arriba]263-arriba ! "[1396-the basque] [he]1396-the basque said . " Lift it up . "[1396-the basque]

[Bill]240-bill raised the wine - skin and let the stream of wine spurt out and into [his]240-bill mouth , [his]240-bill head tipped back . When [he]240-bill stopped drinking and tipped the leather bottle down a few drops ran down [his]240-bill chin .

" No ! No ! "[1399-several basques] [several Basques]1399-several basques said . " Not like that . "[1399-several basques] [One]3367-one snatched the bottle away from [the owner]1401-the owner , who was [himself]1401-the owner about to give a demonstration . [He]1401-the owner was [a young fellow]1402-a young fellow and [he]1401-the owner held the wine - bottle at full arms ' length and raised it high up , squeezing the leather bag with [his]1401-the owner hand so the stream of wine hissed into [his]1401-the owner mouth . [He]1401-the owner held the bag out there , the wine making a flat , hard trajectory into [his]1401-the owner mouth , and [he]1401-the owner kept on swallowing smoothly and regularly .

" Hey ! "[1403-the owner of the bottle] [the owner of the bottle]1403-the owner of the bottle shouted . " Whose wine is that ? "[1403-the owner of the bottle]

[The drinker]1404-the drinker waggled [his]1404-the drinker little finger at [him]1401-the owner and smiled at [us]1405-we with [his]1401-the owner eyes . Then [he]1401-the owner bit the stream off sharp , made a quick lift with the wine - bag and lowered it down to [the owner]1401-the owner . [He]1401-the owner winked at [us]1405-we . [The owner]1401-the owner shook the wine - skin sadly .

[We]1405-we passed through [a town]1408-a town and stopped in front of [the posada]1409-the posada , and [the driver]454-the driver took on several packages . Then [we]1405-we started on again , and outside [the town]3300-the town the road commenced to mount . [We]1405-we were going through [farming country with rocky hills that sloped down into [the fields]1076-the fields]1412-farming country with rocky hills that sloped down into the fields . [The grain - fields]1414-the grain - fields went up [the hillsides]1415-the hillsides . Now as [we]1405-we went higher there was a wind blowing the grain . [The road]1170-the road was white and dusty , and the dust rose under the wheels and hung in the air behind [us]1405-we . [The road]1170-the road climbed up into [the hills]1385-the hills and left [the rich grain - fields]1419-the rich grain - fields below . Now there were only patches of grain on [the bare hillsides]1420-the bare hillsides and on each side of the water - courses . [We]1405-we turned sharply out to the side of [the road]1170-the road to give room to pass to a long string of [six mules]1422-six mules , following one after [the other]1278-the other , hauling [a high - hooded wagon loaded with freight]1424-a high - hooded wagon loaded with freight . [The wagon]1425-the wagon and the mules were covered with dust . Close behind was another string of mules and [another wagon]1426-another wagon . This was loaded with lumber , and [the arriero driving the mules]1427-the arriero driving the mules leaned back and put on the thick wooden brakes as [we]1405-we passed . Up here [the country]3325-the country was quite barren and [the hills]1385-the hills were rocky and hard - baked clay furrowed by the rain .

[We]1405-we came around a curve into [a town]1408-a town , and on both sides opened out [a sudden green valley]1431-a sudden green valley . [A stream]1230-a stream went through [the centre of [the town]3300-the town]1433-the centre of the town and fields of grapes touched [the houses]981-the houses .

[The bus]1140-the bus stopped in front of [a posada]1437-a posada and [many of [the passengers]1439-the passengers]1438-many of the passengers got down , and a lot of the baggage was unstrapped from the roof from under the big tarpaulins and lifted down . [Bill]240-bill and [I]0-rioja alta got down and went into [the posada]1409-the posada . There was [a low , dark room with saddles and harness]1441-a low , dark room with saddles and harness , and hay - forks made of white wood , and clusters of canvas rope - soled shoes and hams and slabs of bacon and white garlics and long sausages hanging from the roof . It was cool and dusky , and [we]1405-we stood in front of a long wooden counter with [two women]1442-two women behind it serving drinks . Behind [them]1442-two women were shelves stacked with supplies and goods .

[We]1405-we each had an aguardiente and paid forty centimes for the two drinks . [I]0-rioja alta gave [the woman]1443-the woman fifty centimes to make a tip , and [she]1443-the woman gave [me]0-rioja alta back the copper piece , thinking [I]0-rioja alta had misunderstood the price .

[Two of [[our]1405-we Basques]1445-our basques]1444-two of our basques came in and insisted on buying a drink . [The road]1170-the road left [the green valley]1455-the green valley at once , and [we]1405-we were up in [the hills]1385-the hills again . [The bus]1140-the bus climbed steadily up [the road]1170-the road . [The country]3325-the country was barren and rocks stuck up through the clay . There was no grass beside [the road]1170-the road . CHAPTER 12

When [I]0-rioja alta woke in the morning [I]0-rioja alta went to the window and looked out . It had cleared and there were no clouds on [the mountains]1027-the mountains . Outside under the window were [some carts]1534-some carts and [an old diligence]1535-an old diligence , the wood of the roof cracked and split by the weather . It must have been left from the days before [the motor - buses]1536-the motor - buses . [A goat]1537-a goat hopped up on one of [the carts]1538-the carts and then to the roof of [the diligence]1539-the diligence . [He]1537-a goat jerked [his]1537-a goat head at [the other goats below]1540-the other goats below and when [I]0-rioja alta waved at [him]1537-a goat [he]1537-a goat bounded down .

[Bill]240-bill was still sleeping , so [I]0-rioja alta dressed , put on [my]0-rioja alta shoes outside in [the hall]1541-the hall , and went down - [stairs]3339-stairs . [No one]360-no one was stirring down - stairs , so [I]0-rioja alta unbolted the door and went out . It was cool outside in the early morning and the sun had not yet dried the dew that had come when the wind died down . [I]0-rioja alta hunted around in [the shed behind [the inn]1507-the inn]1544-the shed behind the inn and found a sort of mattock , and went down toward [the stream]1199-the stream to try and dig some worms for bait . [The stream]1199-the stream was clear and shallow but [it]1199-the stream did not look trouty . On [the grassy bank]1548-the grassy bank where it was damp [I]0-rioja alta drove the mattock into the earth and loosened a chunk of sod . There were worms underneath . They slid out of sight as [I]0-rioja alta lifted the sod and [I]0-rioja alta dug carefully and got a good many . Digging at the edge of the damp ground [I]0-rioja alta filled two empty tobacco - tins with worms and sifted dirt onto them . [The goats]1549-the goats watched [me]0-rioja alta dig .

When [I]0-rioja alta went back into [the inn]1507-the inn [the woman]1443-the woman was down in [the kitchen]680-the kitchen , and [I]0-rioja alta asked [her]1443-the woman to get coffee for [us]1553-us , and that [we]1553-us wanted a lunch . [Bill]240-bill was awake and sitting on the edge of the bed .

" Take some more coffee , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said .

" Good . Coffee is good for [you]240-bill . [It]3938-it 's the caffeine in it . [Caffeine]270-caffeine , [we]3939-we are here . " [I]0-rioja alta do n't know . "[0-rioja alta]

[I]0-rioja alta went to sleep , too . When [I]0-rioja alta woke up [Bill]240-bill was packing the rucksack . It was late in the afternoon and the shadow from the trees was long and went out over [the dam]3974-the dam . [I]0-rioja alta was stiff from sleeping on [the ground]1654-the ground .

[We]1655-we started up [the road]1170-the road into [the woods]3311-the woods . [We]1655-we stayed five days at [Burguete]105-burguete and had good fishing . The nights were cold and the days were hot , and there was always a breeze even in the heat of the day . [Aficion]291-aficion means passion . [An aficionado]1720-an aficionado is one who is passionate about the bull - fights . [All the good bull - fighters]1721-all the good bull - fighters stayed at [[Montoya]260-montoya 's hotel]1722-montoya 's hotel ; that is , [those with aficion]1723-those with aficion stayed [there]3333-there . [They]1731-they often had the most flattering inscriptions . But they did not mean anything . One day [Montoya]260-montoya took them all out and dropped them in the waste - basket . [We]1732-we often talked about bulls and [bull - fighters]3323-bull - fighters . [I]0-rioja alta had stopped at [the Montoya]260-montoya for several years . [Men]580-men would come in from [distant towns]1735-distant towns and before [they]580-men left [Pamplona]81-pamplona stop and talk for a few minutes with [Montoya]260-montoya about [bulls]1736-bulls . [These men]1737-these men were [aficionados]1738-aficionados . [Those who were [aficionados]1738-aficionados]1739-those who were aficionados could always get [rooms]1741-rooms even when [the hotel]913-the hotel was full . [Montoya]260-montoya introduced [me]0-rioja alta to [some of [them]1743-some of them]1743-some of them . [They]1743-some of them were always very polite at first , and it amused [them]1743-some of them very much that [I]0-rioja alta should be [an American]1744-an american . Somehow it was taken for granted that [an American]1744-an american could not have aficion . [He]1744-an american might simulate it or confuse it with excitement , but [he]1744-an american could not really have it . When [they]1743-some of them saw that [I]0-rioja alta had aficion , and there was no password , no set questions that could bring it out , rather it was a sort of oral spiritual examination with the questions always a little on the defensive and never apparent , there was [this same embarrassed putting the hand on the shoulder]1746-this same embarrassed putting the hand on the shoulder , or a " Buen hombre . "[1746-this same embarrassed putting the hand on the shoulder] But nearly always there was the actual touching . It seemed as though [they]1743-some of them wanted to touch [you]1747-you to make it certain .

[Montoya]260-montoya could forgive anything of [a bull - fighter who had aficion]1748-a bull - fighter who had aficion . [He]260-montoya could forgive attacks of nerves , panic , bad unexplainable actions , all sorts of lapses . For one who had aficion [he]1748-a bull - fighter who had aficion could forgive anything . Without [his]1748-a bull - fighter who had aficion ever saying anything they were simply a little something shameful between [us]1750-us , like the spilling open of the horses in bull - fighting .

[Bill]240-bill had gone up - [stairs]3339-stairs as [we]1750-us came in , and [I]0-rioja alta found [him]240-bill washing and changing in [[his]240-bill room]1362-his room .

" Well , "[240-bill] [he]240-bill said , " talk a lot of Spanish ? "[240-bill]

" [He]240-bill was telling [me]240-bill about the bulls coming in to - night . "[240-bill]

" All right . [They]4042-the gang 'll probably be at [the caf]398-the caf . "[240-bill]

" Have [you]240-bill got tickets ? "[240-bill]

" Yes . [I]240-bill got them for all the unloadings . "[240-bill]

" What 's it like ? "[240-bill] [He]240-bill was pulling [his]240-bill cheek before the glass , looking to see if there were unshaved patches under the line of the jaw .

" It 's pretty good , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " Damn good ! "[0-rioja alta]

[The steer]1843-the steer was down now , [his]1843-the steer neck stretched out , [his]1843-the steer head twisted , [he]1843-the steer lay the way [he]1843-the steer had fallen . Suddenly the bull left off and made for the other steer which had been standing at the far end , [his]1843-the steer head swinging , watching it all . [The steer]1843-the steer ran awkwardly and the bull caught [him]1843-the steer , hooked [him]1843-the steer lightly in the flank , and then turned away and looked up at [the crowd on the walls]1859-the crowd on the walls , [his]1843-the steer crest of muscle rising . [The steer]1843-the steer came up to [him]1843-the steer and made as though to nose at [him]1843-the steer and the bull hooked perfunctorily . The next time [he]1843-the steer nosed at the steer and then the two of [them]1861-them trotted over to the other bull .

When [the next bull]1862-the next bull came out , [all three]1863-all three , [the two bulls]1864-the two bulls and [the steer]1843-the steer , stood together , [their]1864-the two bulls heads side by side , [their]1864-the two bulls horns against [the newcomer]1866-the newcomer . [The steer who had been gored]1870-the steer who had been gored had gotten to [his]1870-the steer who had been gored feet and stood against the stone wall . [None of the bulls]1871-none of the bulls came near [him]1843-the steer , and [he]1843-the steer did not attempt to join [the herd]1869-the herd .

[We]1873-we climbed down from the wall with [the crowd]893-the crowd , and had a last look at the bulls through the loopholes in the wall of [the corral]4045-the corral . [They]1869-the herd were all quiet now , [their]1869-the herd heads down . [We]1873-we got [a carriage]1876-a carriage outside and rode up to [the caf]398-the caf . [We]1873-we were sitting in [the caf]398-the caf .

" That 's an extraordinary business , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said .

" Will [those last ones]4098-those last ones fight as well as the first ? "[197-cohn] [Robert Cohn]197-cohn asked . " [They]4098-those last ones seemed to quiet down awfully fast . "[197-cohn]

" [They]1869-the herd all know [each other]560-each other , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " [They]1869-the herd 're only dangerous when [they]1869-the herd 're alone , or only two or three of [them]1869-the herd together . "[0-rioja alta]

" What do [you]240-bill mean , dangerous ? "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said . " [They]1869-the herd all looked dangerous to [me]240-bill . "[240-bill]

" [They]1869-the herd only want to kill when [they]1869-the herd 're alone . Of course , if [you]240-bill went in [there]3333-there [you]240-bill 'd probably detach one of [them]1869-the herd from the herd , and [he]4101-he 'd be dangerous . "[0-rioja alta]

" That 's too complicated , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said . " Do n't [you]219-mike ever detach [me]240-bill from the herd , [Mike]219-mike . "[240-bill]

As a matter of fact , supper was a pleasant meal . [Brett]212-brett wore a black , sleeveless evening dress . [She]212-brett looked quite beautiful .
