It was like certain dinners [I]0-rioja alta remember from the war . There was much wine , an ignored tension , and a feeling of things coming that [you]1897-you could not prevent happening . Under the wine [I]0-rioja alta lost the disgusted feeling and was happy . It seemed [they]1896-they were [all such nice people]1898-all such nice people .

CHAPTER 14

[I]0-rioja alta do not know what time [I]0-rioja alta got to bed . [I]0-rioja alta remember undressing , putting on a bathrobe , and standing out on [the balcony]1769-the balcony . [I]0-rioja alta knew [I]0-rioja alta was quite drunk , and when [I]0-rioja alta came in [I]0-rioja alta put on the light over the head of the bed and started to read . [I]0-rioja alta was reading a book by [Turgenieff]293-turgenieff . Probably [I]0-rioja alta read the same two pages over several times . It was one of the stories in " [A Sportsman]294-a sportsman 's Sketches . "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta had read it before , but it seemed quite new . [The country]3325-the country became very clear and the feeling of pressure in [my]0-rioja alta head seemed to loosen . [I]0-rioja alta was very drunk and [I]0-rioja alta did not want to shut [my]0-rioja alta eyes because [the room]483-the room would go round and round . If [I]0-rioja alta kept on reading that feeling would pass .

[I]0-rioja alta heard [Brett]212-brett and [Robert Cohn]197-cohn come up the stairs . [Cohn]197-cohn said good night outside the door and went on up to [[his]197-cohn room]1362-his room . [I]0-rioja alta heard [Brett]212-brett go into [the room next door]1903-the room next door . [Mike]219-mike was already in bed . [He]219-mike had come in with [me]0-rioja alta an hour before . [He]219-mike woke as [she]1904-she came in , and [they]1905-they talked together . [I]0-rioja alta heard [them]1905-they laugh . [I]0-rioja alta turned off the light and tried to go to sleep . It was not necessary to read any more . [I]0-rioja alta could shut [my]0-rioja alta eyes without getting the wheeling sensation . But [I]0-rioja alta could not sleep . There is no reason why because it is dark [you]1906-you should look at things differently from when it is light . The hell there is n't !

[I]0-rioja alta figured that all out once , and for six months [I]0-rioja alta never slept with the electric light off . That was another bright idea . To hell with [women]408-women , anyway . To hell with [you]1906-you , [Brett Ashley]212-brett .

[Women]408-women made [such swell friends]1909-such swell friends . Awfully swell . In the first place , [you]1906-you had to be in love with [a woman]409-a woman to have a basis of friendship . [I]0-rioja alta had been having [Brett]212-brett for [a friend]3411-a friend . [I]0-rioja alta had not been thinking about [her]409-a woman side of it . [I]0-rioja alta had been getting something for nothing . That only delayed the presentation of the bill . The bill always came . That was one of the swell things [you]1906-you could count on .

[I]0-rioja alta thought [I]0-rioja alta had paid for everything . Not like [the woman]1443-the woman pays and pays and pays . No idea of retribution or punishment . Just exchange of values . [You]1906-you gave up something and got something else . Or [you]1906-you worked for something . [You]1906-you paid some way for everything that was any good . [I]0-rioja alta paid [my]0-rioja alta way into enough things that [I]0-rioja alta liked , so that [I]0-rioja alta had a good time . Either [you]1906-you paid by learning about them , or by experience , or by taking chances , or by money . Enjoying living was learning to get [your]1906-you money 's worth and knowing when [you]1906-you had it . [You]1906-you could get [your]1906-you money 's worth . [The world]587-the world was [a good place to buy in]1914-a good place to buy in . It seemed like a fine philosophy . In five years , [I]0-rioja alta thought , it will seem just as silly as all the other fine philosophies [I]0-rioja alta 've had .

Perhaps that was n't true , though . Perhaps as [you]1906-you went along [you]1906-you did learn something . [I]0-rioja alta did not care what it was all about . All [I]0-rioja alta wanted to know was how to live in it . Maybe if [you]1906-you found out how to live in it [you]1906-you learned from that what it was all about .

[I]0-rioja alta wished [Mike]219-mike would not behave so terribly to [Cohn]197-cohn , though . [Mike]219-mike was [a bad drunk]1915-a bad drunk . [Brett]212-brett was [a good drunk]1916-a good drunk . [Bill]240-bill was [a good drunk]1916-a good drunk . [Cohn]197-cohn was never drunk . [Mike]219-mike was unpleasant after [he]219-mike passed a certain point . [I]0-rioja alta liked to see [him]219-mike hurt [Cohn]197-cohn . [I]0-rioja alta wished [he]219-mike would not do it , though , because afterward it made [me]0-rioja alta disgusted at [myself]0-rioja alta . That was morality ; things that made [you]1906-you disgusted afterward . No , that must be immorality . That was a large statement . What a lot of bilge [I]0-rioja alta could think up at night . What rot , [I]0-rioja alta could hear [Brett]212-brett say it . What rot ! When [you]1906-you were with [English]295-the english [you]1906-you got into the habit of using English expressions in [your]1906-you thinking . The English spoken language -- [the upper classes]1918-the upper classes , anyway -- must have fewer words than [the Eskimo]296-the eskimo . Of course [I]0-rioja alta did n't know anything about [the Eskimo]296-the eskimo . Maybe [the Eskimo]296-the eskimo was a fine language . Say [the Cherokee]297-the cherokee . [I]0-rioja alta did n't know anything about [the Cherokee]1919-the cherokee , either . The English talked with inflected phrases . One phrase to mean everything . [I]0-rioja alta liked them , though . [I]0-rioja alta liked the way [they]1920-they talked . Take [Harris]287-harris . Still [Harris]287-harris was not [the upper classes]1918-the upper classes .

[I]0-rioja alta turned on the light again and read . [I]0-rioja alta read the Turgenieff . [I]0-rioja alta knew that now , reading it in the oversensitized state of [my]0-rioja alta mind after much too much brandy , [I]0-rioja alta would remember it somewhere , and afterward it would seem as though it had really happened to [me]0-rioja alta . [I]0-rioja alta would always have it . That was another good thing [you]1922-you paid for and then had . Some time along toward daylight [I]0-rioja alta went to sleep .

* * * * *

The next two days in [Pamplona]81-pamplona were quiet , and there were no more rows . [The town]3300-the town was getting ready for the fiesta . [Workmen]1924-workmen put up the gate - posts that were to shut off [the side streets]1925-the side streets when the bulls were released from [the corrals]1782-the corrals and came running through [the streets]1282-the streets in the morning on [their]1920-they way to [the ring]1928-the ring . [The workmen]1929-the workmen dug holes and fitted in the timbers , each timber numbered for [its]1930-its regular place . Out on the plateau beyond [the town]3300-the town [employees of [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring]1932-employees of the bull - ring exercised picador horses , galloping [them]1934-them stiff - legged on [the hard , sun - baked fields behind [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring]1935-the hard , sun - baked fields behind the bull - ring . The big gate of [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring was open , and inside [the amphitheatre]1938-the amphitheatre was being swept . [The ring]1928-the ring was rolled and sprinkled , and [carpenters]1940-carpenters replaced weakened or cracked planks in [the barrera]1941-the barrera . Standing at the edge of the smooth rolled sand [you]1942-you could look up in the empty stands and see [old women]1943-old women sweeping out the boxes .

Outside , the fence that led from [the last street of [the town]3300-the town]1944-the last street of the town to [the entrance of [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring]1946-the entrance of the bull - ring was already in place and made a long pen ; [the crowd]893-the crowd would come running down with the bulls behind [them]893-the crowd on the morning of the day of the first bull - fight . Out across [the plain]1246-the plain , where the horse and cattle fair would be , [some gypsies]1950-some gypsies had camped under the trees . [The wine and aguardiente sellers]1951-the wine and aguardiente sellers were putting up [[their]1951-the wine and aguardiente sellers booths]1952-their booths . [One booth]1953-one booth advertised [ANIS DEL TORO]148-anis del toro . The cloth sign hung against the planks in the hot sun . In [the big square that was [the centre of [the town]3300-the town]1433-the centre of the town]1954-the big square that was the centre of the town there was no change yet . [We]1957-we sat in the white wicker chairs on [the terrasse of [the caf]398-the caf]1958-the terrasse of the caf and watched [the motor - buses]1536-the motor - buses come in and unload [peasants]1961-peasants from [the country]3325-the country coming in to [the market]686-the market , and [we]1957-we watched [the buses]1964-the buses fill up and start out with [peasants]1961-peasants sitting with [their]1961-peasants saddle - bags full of the things [they]1961-peasants had bought in [the town]3300-the town . [The tall gray motor - buses]1967-the tall gray motor - buses were the only life of [the square]995-the square except for the pigeons and [the man with a hose who sprinkled [the gravelled square]1970-the gravelled square and watered [the streets]1282-the streets]1969-the man with a hose who sprinkled the gravelled square and watered the streets .

In the evening was the paseo . For an hour after dinner every one , [all the good - looking girls]1972-all the good - looking girls , [the officers from [the garrison]1974-the garrison]1973-the officers from the garrison , [all the fashionable people of [the town]3300-the town]1975-all the fashionable people of the town , walked in [the street]445-the street on one side of [the square]995-the square while [the caf]398-the caf tables filled with [the regular after - dinner crowd]1980-the regular after - dinner crowd .

During the morning [I]0-rioja alta usually sat in [the caf]398-the caf and read the Madrid papers and then walked in [the town]3300-the town or out into [the country]3325-the country . Sometimes [Bill]240-bill went along . Sometimes [he]240-bill wrote in [[his]240-bill room]1362-his room . [Robert Cohn]197-cohn spent the mornings studying Spanish or trying to get a shave at [the barber - shop]1293-the barber - shop . [Brett]212-brett and [Mike]219-mike never got up until noon . [We]1986-we all had a vermouth at [the caf]398-the caf . It was a quiet life and [no one]360-no one was drunk . [I]0-rioja alta went to [church]1989-church a couple of times , once with [Brett]212-brett . [She]212-brett said [she]212-brett wanted to hear [me]0-rioja alta go to confession , but [I]0-rioja alta told [her]212-brett that not only was it impossible but it was not as interesting as it sounded , and , besides , it would be in a language [she]212-brett did not know . [We]1986-we met [Cohn]197-cohn as [we]1986-we came out of [church]1989-church , and although it was obvious [he]197-cohn had followed [us]1986-we , yet [he]197-cohn was very pleasant and nice , and [we]1986-we all three went for a walk out to [the gypsy camp]1991-the gypsy camp , and [Brett]212-brett had [her]212-brett fortune told .

It was a good morning , there were high white clouds above [the mountains]1027-the mountains . It had rained a little in the night and it was fresh and cool on [the plateau]1250-the plateau , and there was a wonderful view . [We]1986-we all felt good and [we]1986-we felt healthy , and [I]0-rioja alta felt quite friendly to [Cohn]197-cohn . [You]1994-you could not be upset about anything on a day like that .

That was the last day before the fiesta .

CHAPTER 15

At noon of Sunday , the 6th of July , the fiesta exploded . There is no other way to describe it . [People]484-people had been coming in all day from [the country]3325-the country , but [they]484-people were assimilated in [the town]3300-the town and [you]1994-you did not notice [them]484-people . [The square]995-the square was as quiet in the hot sun as on any other day . [The peasants]1999-the peasants were in [the outlying wine - shops]2000-the outlying wine - shops . There [they]1999-the peasants were drinking , getting ready for the fiesta . [They]1999-the peasants had come in so recently from [the plains]2001-the plains and [the hills]1385-the hills that it was necessary that [they]1999-the peasants make [their]1999-the peasants shifting in values gradually . [They]1999-the peasants could not start in paying caf prices . [They]1999-the peasants got [their]1999-the peasants money 's worth in [the wine - shops]2003-the wine - shops . Money still had a definite value in hours worked and bushels of grain sold . Late in the fiesta it would not matter what [they]1999-the peasants paid , nor where [they]1999-the peasants bought .

Now on the day of the starting of the fiesta of [San Fermin]149-san fermin [they]1999-the peasants had been in [the wine - shops of [the narrow streets of [the town]3300-the town]2005-the narrow streets of the town]2004-the wine - shops of the narrow streets of the town since early morning . Going down [the streets]1282-the streets in the morning on the way to mass in [the cathedral]1135-the cathedral , [I]0-rioja alta heard [them]1999-the peasants singing through the open doors of [the shops]458-the shops . [They]1999-the peasants were warming up . There were [many people]1773-many people at the eleven o'clock mass . [San Fermin]149-san fermin is also a religious festival .

[I]0-rioja alta walked down [the hill]567-the hill from [the cathedral]1135-the cathedral and up [the street]445-the street to [the caf on [the square]995-the square]1147-the caf on the square . It was a little before noon . [Robert Cohn]197-cohn and [Bill]240-bill were sitting at one of the tables . The marble - topped tables and the white wicker chairs were gone . They were replaced by cast - iron tables and severe folding chairs . [The caf]398-the caf was like [a battleship stripped for action]2017-a battleship stripped for action . To - day [the waiters]3855-the waiters did not leave [you]2019-you alone all morning to read without asking if [you]2019-you wanted to order something . [A waiter]557-a waiter came up as soon as [I]0-rioja alta sat down .

" What are [you]3855-the waiters drinking ? "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta asked [Bill]240-bill and [Robert]197-cohn .

" Sherry , "[197-cohn] [Cohn]197-cohn said .

" [Jerez]298-jerez , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said to [the waiter]447-the waiter .

Before [the waiter]447-the waiter brought the sherry the rocket that announced the fiesta went up in [the square]995-the square . It burst and there was a gray ball of smoke high up above [the Theatre Gayarre]2024-the theatre gayarre , across on [the other side of [the plaza]1706-the plaza]2025-the other side of the plaza . The ball of smoke hung in the sky like a shrapnel burst , and as [I]0-rioja alta watched , another rocket came up to it , trickling smoke in the bright sunlight . [I]0-rioja alta saw the bright flash as it burst and another little cloud of smoke appeared . By the time the second rocket had burst there were [so many people in [the arcade]1288-the arcade]2027-so many people in the arcade , that had been empty a minute before , that [the waiter]447-the waiter , holding the bottle high up over [his]447-the waiter head , could hardly get through [the crowd]893-the crowd to [our]2031-our table . [People]484-people were coming into [the square]995-the square from all sides , and down [the street]445-the street [we]2031-our heard the pipes and the fifes and the drums coming . [They]484-people were playing the _ riau - riau _ music , the pipes shrill and the drums pounding , and behind [them]484-people came [the men]816-the men and [boys]1816-boys dancing . When [the fifers]2037-the fifers stopped [they]484-people all crouched down in [the street]445-the street , and when the reed - pipes and the fifes shrilled , and the flat , dry , hollow drums tapped it out again , [they]484-people all went up in the air dancing . In [the crowd]893-the crowd [you]2040-you saw only the heads and shoulders of [the dancers]2041-the dancers going up and down .

In [the square]995-the square [a man]410-a man , bent over , was playing on a reed - pipe , and [a crowd of [children]3530-children]2044-a crowd of children were following [him]410-a man shouting , and pulling at [his]410-a man clothes . [He]410-a man came out of [the square]995-the square , [the children]2047-the children following [him]410-a man , and piped [them]2047-the children past [the caf]398-the caf and down [a side street]801-a side street . [We]2050-we saw [his]410-a man blank pockmarked face as [he]410-a man went by , piping , [the children]2047-the children close behind [him]410-a man shouting and pulling at [him]410-a man .

" [He]410-a man must be [the village idiot]4142-the village idiot , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said . " [[My]240-bill God]3370-my god ! look at that ! "[240-bill]

Down [the street]445-the street came [dancers]2053-dancers . [The street]445-the street was solid with [dancers]2053-dancers , [all men]2056-all men . [They]2053-dancers were all dancing in time behind [[their]2053-dancers own fifers]2057-their own fifers and [drummers]2058-drummers . [They]2053-dancers were a club of some sort , and all wore [workmen]1924-workmen 's blue smocks , and red handkerchiefs around [their]2053-dancers necks , and carried a great banner on two poles . The banner danced up and down with [them]2053-dancers as [they]2053-dancers came down surrounded by [the crowd]893-the crowd .

" Hurray for Wine ! Hurray for [the Foreigners]299-the foreigners ! "[893-the crowd] was painted on the banner .

" Where are [the foreigners]4144-the foreigners ? "[197-cohn] [Robert Cohn]197-cohn asked .

" [We]4144-the foreigners 're [the foreigners]4144-the foreigners , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

All the time rockets were going up . The caf tables were all full now . [The square]995-the square was emptying of [people]484-people and [the crowd]893-the crowd was filling [the caf]398-the caf s.

" Where 's [Brett]212-brett and [Mike]219-mike ? "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill asked .

" [I]197-cohn 'll go and get [them]2068-all the dignitaries , "[197-cohn] [Cohn]197-cohn said .

" Bring [them]2068-all the dignitaries here . "[893-the crowd]

The fiesta was really started . [It]2065-it kept up day and night for seven days . The dancing kept up , the drinking kept up , the noise went on . The things that happened could only have happened during a fiesta . Everything became quite unreal finally and it seemed as though nothing could have any consequences . It seemed out of place to think of consequences during the fiesta . All during the fiesta [you]2066-you had the feeling , even when it was quiet , that [you]2066-you had to shout any remark to make it heard . It was the same feeling about any action . It was a fiesta and it went on for seven days .

That afternoon was the big religious procession . [San Fermin]149-san fermin was translated from [one church]2067-one church to another . In the procession were [all the dignitaries]2068-all the dignitaries , civil and religious . [We]2069-we could not see [them]2068-all the dignitaries because [the crowd]893-the crowd was too great . Ahead of the formal procession and behind [it]2071-it danced [the _ riau - riau _ dancers]2072-the _ riau - riau _ dancers . There was one mass of yellow shirts dancing up and down in [the crowd]893-the crowd . All [we]2069-we could see of the procession through [the closely pressed people that crowded all [the side streets]1925-the side streets and curbs]2074-the closely pressed people that crowded all the side streets and curbs were the great giants , [cigar - store Indians]2076-cigar - store indians , thirty feet high , [Moors]301-moors , [a King]2077-a king and [Queen]2078-queen , whirling and waltzing solemnly to [the _ riau - riau _]2079-the _ riau - riau _ .

[They]2074-the closely pressed people that crowded all the side streets and curbs were all standing outside [the chapel]2080-the chapel where [San Fermin]149-san fermin and [the dignitaries]2081-the dignitaries had passed in , leaving [a guard of [soldiers]2083-soldiers]2082-a guard of soldiers , [the giants]2084-the giants , with [the men who danced in [them]2084-the giants standing beside [their]2084-the giants resting frames]2085-the men who danced in them standing beside their resting frames , and [the dwarfs]2086-the dwarfs moving with [their]2086-the dwarfs whacking bladders through [the crowd]893-the crowd . [We]2088-we started inside and there was a smell of incense and [people]484-people filing back into [the church]1500-the church , but [Brett]212-brett was stopped just inside the door because [she]212-brett had no hat , so [we]2088-we went out again and along [the street]445-the street that ran back from [the chapel]2080-the chapel into [town]394-town . [The street]445-the street was lined on both sides with [people]484-people keeping [their]484-people place at the curb for the return of [the procession]2096-the procession . [Some dancers]2097-some dancers formed a circle around [Brett]212-brett and started to dance . [They]2097-some dancers wore big wreaths of white garlics around [their]2097-some dancers necks . [They]2097-some dancers took [Bill]240-bill and [me]0-rioja alta by the arms and put [us]2088-we in the circle . [Bill]240-bill started to dance , too . [They]2097-some dancers were all chanting . [Brett]212-brett wanted to dance but [they]2097-some dancers did not want [her]212-brett to . [They]2097-some dancers wanted [her]212-brett as an image to dance around . When the song ended with the sharp _ riau - riau ! _ [they]2097-some dancers rushed [us]2088-we into [a wine - shop]1783-a wine - shop .

[We]2088-we stood at the counter . [They]2097-some dancers had [Brett]212-brett seated on a wine - cask . It was dark in [the wine - shop]2099-the wine - shop and full of [men singing , hard - voiced singing]2100-men singing , hard - voiced singing . Back of the counter [they]2097-some dancers drew the wine from casks . [I]0-rioja alta put down money for the wine , but [one of [the men]816-the men]2101-one of the men picked it up and put it back in [my]0-rioja alta pocket .

" [I]240-bill want a leather wine - bottle , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

" There 's a place down [the street]445-the street , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " [I]0-rioja alta 'll go get [a couple]4147-a couple . "[0-rioja alta]

[The dancers]2041-the dancers did not want [me]0-rioja alta to go out . [Three of [them]2041-the dancers]2104-three of them were sitting on the high wine - cask beside [Brett]212-brett , teaching [her]212-brett to drink out of the wine - skins . [They]2097-some dancers had hung a wreath of garlics around [her]212-brett neck . [Some one]471-some one insisted on giving [her]212-brett a glass . [Somebody]351-somebody was teaching [Bill]240-bill a song . Singing it into [his]240-bill ear . Beating time on [Bill]240-bill 's back .

[I]0-rioja alta explained to [them]2097-some dancers that [I]0-rioja alta would be back . Outside in [the street]445-the street [I]0-rioja alta went down [the street]445-the street looking for [the shop that made leather wine - bottles]2109-the shop that made leather wine - bottles . [The crowd]893-the crowd was packed on [the sidewalks]2111-the sidewalks and [many of [the shops]458-the shops]2112-many of the shops were shuttered , and [I]0-rioja alta could not find [it]2109-the shop that made leather wine - bottles . [I]0-rioja alta walked as far as [the church]1500-the church , looking on both sides of [the street]445-the street . Then [I]0-rioja alta asked [a man]410-a man and [he]410-a man took [me]0-rioja alta by the arm and led [me]0-rioja alta to it . The shutters were up but the door was open .

Inside [it]2117-it smelled of fresh tanned leather and hot tar . [A man]410-a man was stencilling completed wine - skins . They hung from the roof in bunches . [He]410-a man took one down , blew it up , screwed the nozzle tight , and then jumped on it

" See ! It does n't leak . "[410-a man]

" [I]410-a man want another one , too . A big one . "[410-a man]

[He]410-a man took down a big one that would hold a gallon or more , from the roof . [He]410-a man blew it up , [his]410-a man cheeks puffing ahead of the wine - skin , and stood on the bota holding on to a chair .

" What are [you]410-a man going to do ? Sell them in [Bayonne]101-bayonne ? "[410-a man]

" No . Drink out of them . "[2119-the man who was stencilling the new ones and tossing them into a pile]

[He]410-a man slapped [me]0-rioja alta on the back .

" [Good man]4148-good man . Eight pesetas for the two . The lowest price . "[410-a man]

[The man who was stencilling the new ones and tossing them into a pile]2119-the man who was stencilling the new ones and tossing them into a pile stopped .

" It 's true , "[410-a man] [he]410-a man said . " Eight pesetas is cheap . "[410-a man]

[I]0-rioja alta paid and went out and along [the street]445-the street back to [the wine - shop]2099-the wine - shop . It was darker than ever inside and very crowded . [I]0-rioja alta did not see [Brett]212-brett and [Bill]240-bill , and [some one]471-some one said [they]2123-they were in [the back room]2124-the back room . At the counter [the girl]450-the girl filled the two wine - skins for [me]0-rioja alta . One held two litres . The other held five litres . Filling them both cost three pesetas sixty centimos . [Some one at the counter]2126-some one at the counter , that [I]0-rioja alta had never seen before , tried to pay for the wine , but [I]0-rioja alta finally paid for it [myself]0-rioja alta . [The man who had wanted to pay]2127-the man who had wanted to pay then bought [me]0-rioja alta a drink . [He]2127-the man who had wanted to pay would not let [me]0-rioja alta buy one in return , but said [he]2127-the man who had wanted to pay would take a rinse of the mouth from the new wine - bag . [He]2127-the man who had wanted to pay tipped the big five - litre bag up and squeezed it so the wine hissed against the back of [his]2127-the man who had wanted to pay throat .

" All right , "[2127-the man who had wanted to pay] [he]2127-the man who had wanted to pay said , and handed back the bag .

In [the back room]2124-the back room [Brett]212-brett and [Bill]240-bill were sitting on barrels surrounded by [the dancers]2041-the dancers . [Everybody]3344-everybody had [his]3344-everybody arms on [everybody else]2131-everybody else 's shoulders , and [they]2041-the dancers were all singing . [Mike]219-mike was sitting at a table with [several men in [their]2132-several men in their shirt - sleeves shirt - sleeves]2132-several men in their shirt - sleeves , eating from a bowl of tuna fish , chopped onions and vinegar . [They]2041-the dancers were all drinking wine and mopping up the oil and vinegar with pieces of bread .

" Hello , [Jake]202-jake . Hello ! "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike called . " Come here . [I]219-mike want [you]202-jake to meet [[my]219-mike friends]436-my friends . [We]2041-the dancers 're all having an hors - d'oeuvre . "[219-mike]

[I]0-rioja alta was introduced to [the people at the table]2133-the people at the table . [They]2133-the people at the table supplied [their]2133-the people at the table names to [Mike]219-mike and sent for a fork for [me]0-rioja alta .

" Stop eating [their]436-my friends dinner , [Michael]219-mike , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett shouted from the wine - barrels .

" [I]0-rioja alta do n't want to eat up [your]471-some one meal , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said when [some one]471-some one handed [me]0-rioja alta a fork .

" Eat , "[471-some one] [he]471-some one said . " What do [you]471-some one think it 's here for ? "[471-some one]

[I]0-rioja alta unscrewed the nozzle of the big wine - bottle and handed it around . [Every one]505-every one took a drink , tipping the wine - skin at arm 's length .

Outside , above the singing , [we]2136-we could hear the music of the procession going by .

" Is n't that the procession ? "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike asked .

" [Nada]302-nada , "[471-some one] [some one]471-some one said . " [It]302-nada 's nothing . Drink up . Lift the bottle . "[471-some one]

" Where did [they]436-my friends find [you]219-mike ? "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta asked [Mike]219-mike .

" Where 's [Cohn]197-cohn ? "[471-some one]

" [He]197-cohn 's passed out , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett called . " [They]436-my friends 've put [him]197-cohn away somewhere . "[212-brett]

" Where is [he]197-cohn ? "[471-some one]

" [I]212-brett do n't know . "[212-brett]

" How should [we]4152-we know , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said . " [I]240-bill think [he]197-cohn 's dead . "[240-bill]

" [He]197-cohn 's not dead , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said . " [I]219-mike know [he]197-cohn 's not dead . [He]197-cohn 's just passed out on [Anis del Mono]150-anis del mono . "[219-mike]

As [he]219-mike said [Anis del Mono]150-anis del mono one of [the men at the table]2138-the men at the table looked up , brought out a bottle from inside [his]219-mike smock , and handed it to [me]0-rioja alta .

[I]0-rioja alta took a drink . It tasted of licorice and warmed all the way . [I]0-rioja alta could feel it warming in [my]0-rioja alta stomach .

" Where the hell is [Cohn]197-cohn ? "[0-rioja alta]

" [I]219-mike do n't know , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said . " [I]219-mike 'll ask . Where is [the drunken comrade]4153-the drunken comrade ? "[219-mike] [he]219-mike asked in Spanish .

" [You]0-rioja alta want to see [him]4153-the drunken comrade ? "[0-rioja alta]

" Yes , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said .

" Not [me]219-mike , "[219-mike] said [Mike]219-mike . " [This gent]4154-this gent . "[219-mike]

[The Anis del Mono man]2139-the anis del mono man wiped [his]2139-the anis del mono man mouth and stood up .

" Come on . "[2139-the anis del mono man]

In [a back room]2140-a back room [Robert Cohn]197-cohn was sleeping quietly on some wine - casks . It was almost too dark to see [his]197-cohn face . [They]2141-they had covered [him]197-cohn with a coat and another coat was folded under [his]197-cohn head . Around [his]197-cohn neck and on [his]197-cohn chest was a big wreath of twisted garlics .

" Let [him]197-cohn sleep , "[702-the man] [the man]702-the man whispered . " [He]197-cohn 's all right . "[702-the man]

Two hours later [Cohn]197-cohn appeared . [He]197-cohn came into [the front room]2143-the front room still with the wreath of garlics around [his]197-cohn neck . [The Spaniards]304-the spaniards shouted when [he]197-cohn came in . [Cohn]197-cohn wiped [his]197-cohn eyes and grinned .

" [I]197-cohn must have been sleeping , "[197-cohn] [he]197-cohn said .

" Oh , not at all , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said .

" [You]197-cohn were only dead , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

" Are n't [we]4155-we going to go and have some supper ? "[197-cohn] [Cohn]197-cohn asked .

" Do [you]197-cohn want to eat ? "[197-cohn]

" Yes . Why not ? [I]197-cohn 'm hungry . "[197-cohn]

" Eat those garlics , [Robert]197-cohn , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said . " [I]219-mike say . Do eat those garlics . "[219-mike]

[Cohn]197-cohn stood there . [His]197-cohn sleep had made [him]197-cohn quite all right .

" Do let 's go and eat , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said . " [I]212-brett must get a bath . "[212-brett]

" Come on , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said . " Let 's translate [Brett]212-brett to [the hotel]913-the hotel . "[240-bill]

[We]2144-we said good - bye to [many people]1773-many people and shook hands with [many people]1773-many people and went out . Outside it was dark .

" What time is it do [you]219-mike suppose ? "[197-cohn] [Cohn]197-cohn asked .

" It 's to - morrow , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said . " [You]197-cohn 've been asleep two days . "[219-mike]

" No , "[197-cohn] said [Cohn]197-cohn , " what time is it ? "[197-cohn]

" It 's ten o'clock . "[219-mike]

" What a lot [we]2144-we 've drunk . "[197-cohn]

" [You]197-cohn mean what a lot _ [we]2144-we 've _ drunk . [You]197-cohn went to sleep . "[219-mike]

Going down [the dark streets]2147-the dark streets to [the hotel]913-the hotel [we]2144-we saw the sky - rockets going up in [the square]995-the square . Down [the side streets that led to [the square]995-the square]2150-the side streets that led to the square [we]2144-we saw [the square]995-the square solid with [people]484-people , [those in the centre]2154-those in the centre all dancing .

It was a big meal at [the hotel]913-the hotel . It was the first meal of the prices being doubled for the fiesta , and there were several new courses . The bull - fight on the second day was much better than on the first . [Brett]212-brett sat between [Mike]219-mike and [me]0-rioja alta at [the barrera]1941-the barrera , and [Bill]240-bill and [Cohn]197-cohn went up above . [Romero]306-romero was the whole show . [I]0-rioja alta do not think [Brett]212-brett saw [any other bull - fighter]2248-any other bull - fighter . [No one else]2249-no one else did either , except [the hard - shelled technicians]2250-the hard - shelled technicians . It was all [Romero]306-romero . There were [two other matadors]2251-two other matadors , but [they]2251-two other matadors did not count . [I]0-rioja alta sat beside [Brett]212-brett and explained to [Brett]212-brett what it was all about . [I]0-rioja alta told [her]212-brett about watching the bull , not the horse , when the bulls charged [the picadors]2252-the picadors , and got [her]212-brett to watching [the picador]4165-the picador place the point of [his]4165-the picador pic so that [she]212-brett saw what it was all about , so that it became more something that was going on with a definite end , and less of a spectacle with unexplained horrors . [I]0-rioja alta had [her]212-brett watch how [Romero]306-romero took the bull away from a fallen horse with [his]306-romero cape , and how [he]306-romero held [him]306-romero with the cape and turned [him]306-romero , smoothly and suavely , never wasting the bull . [She]212-brett saw how [Romero]306-romero avoided every brusque movement and saved [his]306-romero bulls for the last when [he]306-romero wanted them , not winded and discomposed but smoothly worn down . [She]212-brett saw how close [Romero]306-romero always worked to the bull , and [I]0-rioja alta pointed out to [her]212-brett the tricks [the other bull - fighters]2254-the other bull - fighters used to make it look as though [they]2254-the other bull - fighters were working closely . [She]212-brett saw why [she]212-brett liked [Romero]306-romero 's cape - work and why [she]212-brett did not like [the others]3358-the others .

[Romero]306-romero never made any contortions , always it was straight and pure and natural in line . [The others]3358-the others twisted [themselves]3358-the others like corkscrews , [their]3358-the others elbows raised , and leaned against the flanks of the bull after [his]306-romero horns had passed , to give a faked look of danger . Afterward , all that was faked turned bad and gave an unpleasant feeling . [Romero]306-romero 's bull - fighting gave real emotion , because [he]306-romero kept the absolute purity of line in [his]306-romero movements and always quietly and calmly let the horns pass [him]306-romero close each time . [He]306-romero did not have to emphasize [their]2254-the other bull - fighters closeness . [Brett]212-brett saw how something that was beautiful done close to the bull was ridiculous if it were done a little way off . [I]0-rioja alta told [her]212-brett how since the death of [Joselito]307-joselito all [the bull - fighters]2257-the bull - fighters had been developing a technic that simulated this appearance of danger in order to give a fake emotional feeling , while [the bull - fighter]2258-the bull - fighter was really safe . [Romero]306-romero had the old thing , the holding of [his]306-romero purity of line through the maximum of exposure , while [he]306-romero dominated the bull by making [him]306-romero realize [he]306-romero was unattainable , while [he]306-romero prepared [him]306-romero for the killing .

" [I]212-brett 've never seen [him]306-romero do an awkward thing , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said .

" [You]212-brett wo n't until [he]306-romero gets frightened , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said .

" [He]306-romero 'll never be frightened , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said . " [He]306-romero knows too damned much . "[219-mike]

" [He]306-romero knew everything when [he]306-romero started . [The others]3358-the others ca n't ever learn what [he]306-romero was born with . "[212-brett]

" And [God]201-god , what looks , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said .

" [I]219-mike believe , [you]212-brett know , that [she]4196-her 's falling in love with [this bull - fighter chap]4197-this bull - fighter chap , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said .

" [I]212-brett would n't be surprised . "[212-brett]

" [He]2261-he looks that way , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said .

" Does n't [he]2261-he ? "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said .

[They]2259-they had hitched the mules to the dead bull and then the whips cracked , [the men]816-the men ran , and the mules , straining forward , [their]2259-they legs pushing , broke into a gallop , and the bull , one horn up , [his]2261-he head on its side , swept a swath smoothly across [the sand]2262-the sand and out the red gate .

" This next is the last one . "[2261-he]

" Not really , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said . [She]212-brett leaned forward on [the barrera]1941-the barrera . After it was over [we]2265-we went out and were pressed tight in [the crowd]893-the crowd .

" These bull - fights are hell on one , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said . " [I]212-brett 'm limp as a rag . "[212-brett]

" Oh , [you]306-romero 'll get a drink , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said .

The next day [Pedro Romero]306-romero did not fight . It was [Miura]308-miura bulls , and a very bad bull - fight . The next day there was no bull - fight scheduled . But all day and all night the fiesta kept on .

CHAPTER 16

In the morning it was raining . A fog had come over [the mountains]1027-the mountains from [the sea]3296-the sea . [You]2269-you could not see [the tops of [the mountains]1027-the mountains]2270-the tops of the mountains . [The plateau]1250-the plateau was dull and gloomy , and the shapes of the trees and [the houses]981-the houses were changed . [I]0-rioja alta walked out beyond [the town]3300-the town to look at the weather . The bad weather was coming over [the mountains]1027-the mountains from [the sea]3296-the sea .

The flags in [the square]995-the square hung wet from the white poles and the banners were wet and hung damp against the front of [the houses]981-the houses , and in between the steady drizzle the rain came down and drove every one under [the arcades]1887-the arcades and made pools of water in [the square]995-the square , and [the streets]1282-the streets wet and dark and deserted ; yet the fiesta kept up without any pause . It was only driven under cover .

The covered seats of [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring had been crowded with [people sitting out of the rain]2283-people sitting out of the rain watching the concourse of [Basque and Navarrais dancers]2284-basque and navarrais dancers and [singers]2285-singers , and afterward [the Val Carlos dancers in [their]2286-the val carlos dancers in their costumes costumes]2286-the val carlos dancers in their costumes danced down [the street]445-the street in the rain , the drums sounding hollow and damp , and [the chiefs of the bands]2288-the chiefs of the bands riding ahead on [their]2288-the chiefs of the bands big , heavy - footed horses , [their]2288-the chiefs of the bands costumes wet , the horses ' coats wet in the rain . [The crowd]893-the crowd was in [the caf s]1886-the caf s and [the dancers]2041-the dancers came in , too , and sat , [their]2041-the dancers tight - wound white legs under the tables , shaking the water from [their]2041-the dancers belled caps , and spreading [their]2041-the dancers red and purple jackets over the chairs to dry . It was raining hard outside .

CHAPTER 18

At noon [we]2608-we were all at [the caf]398-the caf . It was crowded . [We]2608-we were eating shrimps and drinking beer . [The town]3300-the town was crowded . [Every street]2611-every street was full . [Big motor - cars]2612-big motor - cars from [Biarritz]55-biarritz and [San Sebastian]78-san sebastian kept driving up and parking around [the square]995-the square . [They]2612-big motor - cars brought [people]484-people for the bull - fight . [Sight - seeing cars]2615-sight - seeing cars came up , too . There was one with [twenty - five Englishwomen]2616-twenty - five englishwomen in [it]2615-sight - seeing cars . [They]2616-twenty - five englishwomen sat in [the big , white car]2617-the big , white car and looked through [their]2616-twenty - five englishwomen glasses at [the fiesta]2568-the fiesta . [The dancers]2041-the dancers were all quite drunk . It was the last day of the fiesta .

[The fiesta]2568-the fiesta was solid and unbroken , but the [motor - cars]2621-motor - cars and [tourist - cars]2622-tourist - cars made little islands of [onlookers]2623-onlookers . [You]2627-you did not see [them]2625-the onlookers again except as sport clothes , odd - looking at a table among [the closely packed peasants in black smocks]2628-the closely packed peasants in black smocks . [We]2670-we had stopped at the floor [[our]2670-we rooms]2671-our rooms were on . [She]212-brett went straight down [the hall]1541-the hall and into [[Romero]306-romero 's room]2673-romero 's room . [I]0-rioja alta stood in front of the door of [[Mike]219-mike 's room]2674-mike 's room and knocked . There was no answer . [I]0-rioja alta tried the knob and it opened . When the fiesta boiled over and toward [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring [we]2678-we went with [the crowd]893-the crowd . Behind [us]2678-we the concrete stands filled solidly . Out in front , beyond the red fence , the sand of the ring was smooth - rolled and yellow . It looked a little heavy from the rain , but it was dry in the sun and firm and smooth . [Romero]306-romero did not look up at [us]2733-us . [He]306-romero was speaking to [Belmonte]329-belmonte . [Belmonte]329-belmonte had sent [his]329-belmonte formal cape over to [some friends]2739-some friends . [He]329-belmonte looked across at [them]2739-some friends and smiled , [his]329-belmonte wolf smile that was only with the mouth . [Romero]306-romero leaned over the barrera and asked for the water - jug . [The sword - handler]2211-the sword - handler brought it and [Romero]306-romero poured water over the percale of [his]306-romero fighting - cape , and then scuffed the lower folds in the sand with [his]306-romero slippered foot .

" What 's that for ? "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett asked .

" To give it weight in the wind . "[329-belmonte]

" [His]329-belmonte face looks bad , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

" [He]329-belmonte feels very badly , "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett said . " [He]329-belmonte should be in bed . "[212-brett]

The first bull was [Belmonte]329-belmonte 's . [Belmonte]329-belmonte was very good . But because [he]329-belmonte got thirty thousand pesetas and [people]484-people had stayed in line all night to buy tickets to see [him]329-belmonte , [the crowd]893-the crowd demanded that [he]329-belmonte should be more than very good . [Belmonte]329-belmonte 's great attraction is working close to the bull . In bull - fighting [they]484-people speak of the terrain of the bull and the terrain of [the bull - fighter]2258-the bull - fighter . As long as [a bull - fighter]4415-a bull - fighter stays in [[his]4415-a bull - fighter own terrain]2745-his own terrain [he]4415-a bull - fighter is comparatively safe . Each time [he]4415-a bull - fighter enters into the terrain of the bull [he]4415-a bull - fighter is in great danger . [Belmonte]329-belmonte , in [his]329-belmonte best days , worked always in the terrain of the bull . This way [he]329-belmonte gave the sensation of coming tragedy . [People]484-people went to [the corrida]2747-the corrida to see [Belmonte]329-belmonte , to be given tragic sensations , and perhaps to see the death of [Belmonte]329-belmonte . Fifteen years ago [they]484-people said if [you]2748-you wanted to see [Belmonte]329-belmonte [you]2748-you should go quickly , while [he]329-belmonte was still alive . Since then [he]329-belmonte has killed more than a thousand bulls . When [he]329-belmonte retired the legend grew up about how [his]329-belmonte bull - fighting had been , and when [he]329-belmonte came out of retirement [the public]2749-the public were disappointed because [no real man]2750-no real man could work as close to the bulls as [Belmonte]329-belmonte was supposed to have done , not , of course , even [Belmonte]329-belmonte .

Also [Belmonte]329-belmonte imposed conditions and insisted that [his]329-belmonte bulls should not be too large , nor too dangerously armed with horns , and so the element that was necessary to give the sensation of tragedy was not there , and [the public]2749-the public , who wanted three times as much from [Belmonte]329-belmonte , who was sick with a fistula , as [Belmonte]329-belmonte had ever been able to give , felt defrauded and cheated , and [Belmonte]329-belmonte 's jaw came further out in contempt , and [his]329-belmonte face turned yellower , and [he]329-belmonte moved with greater difficulty as [his]329-belmonte pain increased , and finally [the crowd]893-the crowd were actively against [him]329-belmonte , and [he]329-belmonte was utterly contemptuous and indifferent . [He]329-belmonte had meant to have a great afternoon , and instead it was an afternoon of sneers , shouted insults , and finally a volley of cushions and pieces of bread and vegetables , thrown down at [him]329-belmonte in [the plaza where [he]329-belmonte had had [his]329-belmonte greatest triumphs]2753-the plaza where he had had his greatest triumphs . [His]329-belmonte jaw only went further out . Sometimes [he]329-belmonte turned to smile that toothed , long - jawed , lipless smile when [he]329-belmonte was called something particularly insulting , and always the pain that any movement produced grew stronger and stronger , until finally [his]329-belmonte yellow face was parchment color , and after [his]329-belmonte second bull was dead and the throwing of bread and cushions was over , after [he]329-belmonte had saluted [the President with the same wolf - jawed smile and contemptuous eyes]2754-the president with the same wolf - jawed smile and contemptuous eyes , and handed [his]329-belmonte sword over the barrera to be wiped , and put back in its case , [he]329-belmonte passed through into [the callejon]2694-the callejon and leaned on the barrera below [us]2756-us , [his]329-belmonte head on [his]329-belmonte arms , not seeing , not hearing anything , only going through [his]329-belmonte pain . When [he]329-belmonte looked up , finally , [he]329-belmonte asked for a drink of water . [He]329-belmonte swallowed a little , rinsed [his]329-belmonte mouth , spat the water , took [his]329-belmonte cape , and went back into [the ring]1928-the ring .

Because [they]2758-they were against [Belmonte]329-belmonte [the public]2749-the public were for [Romero]306-romero . From the moment [he]329-belmonte left [the barrera]1941-the barrera and went toward the bull [they]2758-they applauded [him]329-belmonte . [Belmonte]329-belmonte watched [Romero]306-romero , too , watched [him]306-romero always without seeming to . [He]329-belmonte paid no attention to [Marcial]309-marcial . [Marcial]309-marcial was the sort of thing [he]329-belmonte knew all about . [He]329-belmonte had come out of retirement to compete with [Marcial]309-marcial , knowing it was a competition gained in advance . [He]329-belmonte had expected to compete with [Marcial]309-marcial and [the other stars of the decadence of bull - fighting]2761-the other stars of the decadence of bull - fighting , and [he]329-belmonte knew that the sincerity of [his]329-belmonte own bull - fighting would be so set off by the false sthetics of [the bull - fighters of the decadent period]2762-the bull - fighters of the decadent period that [he]329-belmonte would only have to be in [the ring]1928-the ring . [His]329-belmonte return from retirement had been spoiled by [Romero]306-romero . [Romero]306-romero did always , smoothly , calmly , and beautifully , what [he]306-romero , [Belmonte]329-belmonte , could only bring [himself]306-romero to do now sometimes . [The crowd]893-the crowd felt it , even [the people from [Biarritz]55-biarritz]2765-the people from biarritz , even [the American ambassador]4204-the american ambassador saw it , finally . It was a competition that [Belmonte]329-belmonte would not enter because it would lead only to a bad horn wound or death . [Belmonte]329-belmonte was no longer well enough . [He]329-belmonte no longer had [his]329-belmonte greatest moments in [the bull - ring]1261-the bull - ring . [He]329-belmonte was not sure that there were any great moments . Things were not the same and now life only came in flashes . [He]329-belmonte had flashes of the old greatness with [his]329-belmonte bulls , but they were not of value because [he]329-belmonte had discounted [them]2768-them in advance when [he]329-belmonte had picked the bulls out for [their]2768-them safety , getting out of [a motor]2769-a motor and leaning on a fence , looking over at the herd on [the ranch of [[his]329-belmonte friend]2771-his friend [the bull - breeder]1805-the bull - breeder]2770-the ranch of his friend the bull - breeder . So [he]329-belmonte had two small , manageable bulls without much horns , and when [he]329-belmonte felt the greatness again coming , just a little of it through the pain that was always with [him]329-belmonte , it had been discounted and sold in advance , and it did not give [him]329-belmonte a good feeling . It was the greatness , but it did not make bull - fighting wonderful to [him]329-belmonte any more .

[Pedro Romero]306-romero had the greatness . [He]306-romero loved bull - fighting , and [I]0-rioja alta think [he]306-romero loved the bulls , and [I]0-rioja alta think [he]306-romero loved [Brett]212-brett . Everything of which [he]306-romero could control the locality [he]306-romero did in front of [her]212-brett all that afternoon . Never once did [he]306-romero look up . [He]306-romero made it stronger that way , and did it for [himself]306-romero , too , as well as for [her]212-brett . Because [he]306-romero did not look up to ask if it pleased [he]306-romero did it all for [himself]306-romero inside , and it strengthened [him]306-romero , and yet [he]306-romero did it for [her]212-brett , too . But [he]306-romero did not do it for [her]212-brett at any loss to [himself]306-romero . [He]306-romero gained by it all through the afternoon .

[His]306-romero first " quite "[306-romero] was directly below [us]2773-us . [The three matadors]2713-the three matadors take the bull in turn after each charge [he]306-romero makes at [a picador]2775-a picador . [Belmonte]329-belmonte was the first . [Marcial]309-marcial was the second . Then came [Romero]306-romero . [The three of [them]2713-the three matadors]2776-the three of them were standing at the left of the horse . [The picador]4165-the picador , [his]4165-the picador hat down over [his]4165-the picador eyes , the shaft of [his]4165-the picador pic angling sharply toward [the bull]1834-the bull , kicked in the spurs and held them and with the reins in [his]4165-the picador left hand walked the horse forward toward [the bull]1834-the bull . [The bull]1834-the bull was watching . [Seemingly]2781-seemingly [he]1834-the bull watched the white horse , but really [he]1834-the bull watched the triangular steel point of the pic . [Romero]306-romero , watching , saw [the bull]1834-the bull start to turn [his]1834-the bull head . [He]306-romero did not want to charge . [Romero]306-romero flicked [his]306-romero cape so the color caught [the bull]1834-the bull 's eye . [The bull]1834-the bull charged with the reflex , charged , and found not the flash of color but a white horse , and [a man]410-a man leaned far over the horse , shot the steel point of the long hickory shaft into the hump of muscle on the bull 's shoulder , and pulled [his]410-a man horse sideways as [he]410-a man pivoted on the pic , making a wound , enforcing the iron into the bull 's shoulder , making [him]1834-the bull bleed for [Belmonte]329-belmonte .

[The bull]1834-the bull did not insist under the iron . [He]1834-the bull did not really want to get at the horse . [He]1834-the bull turned and [the group]2787-the group broke apart and [Romero]306-romero was taking [him]1834-the bull out with [his]306-romero cape . [He]306-romero took [him]1834-the bull out softly and smoothly , and then stopped and , standing squarely in front of [the bull]1834-the bull , offered [him]1834-the bull the cape . [The bull]1834-the bull 's tail went up and [he]306-romero charged , and [Romero]306-romero moved [his]306-romero arms ahead of [the bull]1834-the bull , wheeling , [his]306-romero feet firmed . The dampened , mud - weighted cape swung open and full as a sail fills , and [Romero]306-romero pivoted with it just ahead of [the bull]1834-the bull . At the end of the pass [they]2792-they were facing each other again . [Romero]306-romero smiled . [The bull]1834-the bull wanted it again , and [Romero]306-romero 's cape filled again , this time on the other side . Each time [he]306-romero let the bull pass so close that [the man]702-the man and the bull and the cape that filled and pivoted ahead of [the bull]1834-the bull were all one sharply etched mass . It was all so slow and so controlled . It was as though [he]306-romero were rocking [the bull]1834-the bull to sleep . [He]306-romero made four veronicas like that , and finished with a half - veronica that turned [his]306-romero back on the bull and came away toward [the applause]2797-the applause , [his]306-romero hand on [his]306-romero hip , [his]306-romero cape on [his]306-romero arm , and [the bull]1834-the bull watching [his]306-romero back going away .

In [his]306-romero own bulls [he]306-romero was perfect . [[His]306-romero first bull]2799-his first bull did not see well . After the first two passes with the cape [Romero]306-romero knew exactly how bad the vision was impaired . [He]306-romero worked accordingly . It was not brilliant bull - fighting . It was only perfect bull - fighting . [The crowd]893-the crowd wanted the bull changed . [They]893-the crowd made a great row . Nothing very fine could happen with a bull that could not see the lures , but [the President]2708-the president would not order [him]1834-the bull replaced .

" Why do n't [they]893-the crowd change [him]1834-the bull ? "[212-brett] [Brett]212-brett asked .

" [They]893-the crowd 've paid for [him]1834-the bull . [They]893-the crowd do n't want to lose [their]893-the crowd money . "[2803-the person who was doing it]

" It 's hardly fair to [Romero]306-romero . "[2803-the person who was doing it]

" Watch how [he]306-romero handles a bull that ca n't see the color . "[2803-the person who was doing it]

" It 's the sort of thing [I]2803-the person who was doing it do n't like to see . "[2803-the person who was doing it]

It was not nice to watch if [you]2802-you cared anything about [the person who was doing it]2803-the person who was doing it . With [the bull who could not see the colors of the capes , or the scarlet flannel of the muleta]2804-the bull who could not see the colors of the capes , or the scarlet flannel of the muleta , [Romero]306-romero had to make [the bull]1834-the bull consent with [his]1834-the bull body . [He]306-romero had to get so close that [the bull]1834-the bull saw [his]1834-the bull body , and would start for it , and then shift [the bull]1834-the bull 's charge to the flannel and finish out the pass in the classic manner . [The Biarritz crowd]2808-the biarritz crowd did not like [it]2809-it [They]2808-the biarritz crowd thought [Romero]306-romero was afraid , and that was why [he]306-romero gave that little sidestep each time as [he]306-romero transferred the bull 's charge from [his]306-romero own body to the flannel . [They]2808-the biarritz crowd preferred [Belmonte]329-belmonte 's imitation of [himself]329-belmonte or [Marcial]309-marcial 's imitation of [Belmonte]329-belmonte . There were three of [them]2808-the biarritz crowd in the row behind [us]2810-us .

" What 's [he]306-romero afraid of the bull for ? [The bull]1834-the bull 's so dumb [he]1834-the bull only goes after the cloth . "[2808-the biarritz crowd]

" [He]1834-the bull 's just [a young bull - fighter]4446-a young bull - fighter . [He]1834-the bull has n't learned it yet . "[2808-the biarritz crowd]

" But [I]2808-the biarritz crowd thought [he]1834-the bull was fine with the cape before . "[2808-the biarritz crowd]

" Probably [he]1834-the bull 's nervous now . "[2808-the biarritz crowd]

Out in the centre of [the ring]1928-the ring , all alone , [Romero]306-romero was going on with the same thing , getting so close that [the bull]1834-the bull could see [him]306-romero plainly , offering the body , offering it again a little closer , [the bull]1834-the bull watching dully , then so close that [the bull]1834-the bull thought [he]306-romero had [him]306-romero , offering again and finally drawing the charge and then , just before the horns came , giving [the bull]1834-the bull the red cloth to follow with at little , almost imperceptible , jerk that so offended the critical judgment of [the Biarritz bull - fight experts]2816-the biarritz bull - fight experts .

" [He]1834-the bull 's going to kill now , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said to [Brett]212-brett . " [The bull]1834-the bull 's still strong . [He]1834-the bull would n't wear [himself]1834-the bull out . "[0-rioja alta]

Out in the centre of [the ring]1928-the ring [Romero]306-romero profiled in front of [the bull]1834-the bull , drew the sword out from the folds of [the muleta]2819-the muleta , rose on [his]306-romero toes , and sighted along the blade . [The bull]1834-the bull charged as [Romero]306-romero charged . [Romero]306-romero 's left hand dropped [the muleta]2819-the muleta over the bull 's muzzle to blind [him]306-romero , [his]306-romero left shoulder went forward between the horns as the sword went in , and for just an instant [he]306-romero and [the bull]1834-the bull were one , [Romero]306-romero way out over [the bull]1834-the bull , the right arm extended high up to where the hilt of the sword had gone in between [the bull]1834-the bull 's shoulders . Then [the figure]2825-the figure was broken . There was a little jolt as [Romero]306-romero came clear , and then [he]306-romero was standing , one hand up , facing [the bull]1834-the bull , [his]306-romero shirt ripped out from under [his]306-romero sleeve , the white blowing in the wind , and [the bull]1834-the bull , the red sword hilt tight between [his]306-romero shoulders , [his]306-romero head going down and [his]306-romero legs settling .

" There [he]1834-the bull goes , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

[Romero]306-romero was close enough so [the bull]1834-the bull could see [him]306-romero . [His]306-romero hand still up , [he]306-romero spoke to [the bull]1834-the bull . [The bull]1834-the bull gathered [himself]1834-the bull , then [his]1834-the bull head went forward and [he]1834-the bull went over slowly , then all over , suddenly , four feet in the air .

[They]2831-they handed the sword to [Romero]306-romero , and carrying it blade down , the muleta in [his]306-romero other hand , [he]306-romero walked over to in front of [[the President]2708-the president 's box]2731-the president 's box , bowed , straightened , and came over to [the barrera]1941-the barrera and handed over the sword and muleta .

" [Bad one]4448-bad one , "[2211-the sword - handler] said [the sword - handler]2211-the sword - handler .

" [He]306-romero made [me]306-romero sweat , "[306-romero] said [Romero]306-romero . [He]306-romero wiped off [his]306-romero face . [He]306-romero did not look up at [us]2837-us .

[Marcial]309-marcial had a big day . [They]2838-they were still applauding [him]309-marcial when [Romero]306-romero 's last bull came in . [It]2839-it was the bull that had sprinted out and killed [the man in the morning running]2840-the man in the morning running .

During [Romero]306-romero 's first bull [his]306-romero hurt face had been very noticeable . Everything [he]306-romero did showed it . All the concentration of the awkwardly delicate working with the bull that could not see well brought it out . The fight with [Cohn]197-cohn had not touched [his]306-romero spirit but [his]306-romero face had been smashed and [his]306-romero body hurt . [He]306-romero was wiping all that out now . Each thing that [he]306-romero did with [this bull]2841-this bull wiped that out a little cleaner . [It]2841-this bull was [a good bull]2842-a good bull , a big bull , and with horns , and it turned and recharged easily and surely . [He]2841-this bull was what [Romero]306-romero wanted in bulls .

When [he]306-romero had finished [his]306-romero work with [the muleta]2819-the muleta and was ready to kill , [the crowd]893-the crowd made [him]306-romero go on . [They]893-the crowd did not want the bull killed yet , [they]893-the crowd did not want it to be over . [Romero]306-romero went on . It was like a course in bull - fighting . All the passes [he]306-romero linked up , all completed , all slow , templed and smooth . There were no tricks and no mystifications . There was no brusqueness . And each pass as it reached [the summit]2845-the summit gave [you]2846-you a sudden ache inside . [The crowd]893-the crowd did not want it ever to be finished .

[The bull]1834-the bull was squared on all four feet to be killed , and [Romero]306-romero killed directly below [us]2849-us . [He]306-romero killed not as [he]306-romero had been forced to by [the last bull]2850-the last bull , but as [he]306-romero wanted to . [He]306-romero profiled directly in front of the bull , drew the sword out of the folds of [the muleta]2819-the muleta and sighted along the blade . [The bull]1834-the bull watched [him]306-romero . [Romero]306-romero spoke to [the bull]1834-the bull and tapped one of [his]1834-the bull feet . [The bull]1834-the bull charged and [Romero]306-romero waited for the charge , [the muleta]2819-the muleta held low , sighting along the blade , [his]2819-the muleta feet firm . Then without taking a step forward , [he]306-romero became one with the bull , the sword was in high between the shoulders , the bull had followed the low - swung flannel , that disappeared as [Romero]306-romero lurched clear to the left , and it was over . [The bull]1834-the bull tried to go forward , [his]1834-the bull legs commenced to settle , [he]1834-the bull swung from side to side , hesitated , then went down on [his]1834-the bull knees , and [[Romero]306-romero 's older brother]2857-romero 's older brother leaned forward behind [him]306-romero and drove a short knife into the bull 's neck at the base of the horns . The first time [he]2857-romero 's older brother missed . [He]2857-romero 's older brother drove the knife in again , and the bull went over , twitching and rigid . [[Romero]306-romero 's brother]2858-romero 's brother , holding the bull 's horn in one hand , the knife in the other , looked up at [the President]2708-the president 's box . [The brother]2862-the brother cut the notched black ear from the dead bull and trotted over with it to [Romero]306-romero . [The bull]1834-the bull lay heavy and black on the sand , [his]1834-the bull tongue out . " [You]212-brett liked it ? "[306-romero] [Romero]306-romero called .

BOOK III

CHAPTER 19

In the morning it was all over . [The fiesta]2568-the fiesta was finished . [I]0-rioja alta woke about nine o'clock , had a bath , dressed , and went down - [stairs]3339-stairs . [The square]995-the square was empty and there were [no people]2924-no people on [the streets]1282-the streets . [A few children]2926-a few children were picking up rocket - sticks in [the square]995-the square . [The caf s]1886-the caf s were just opening and [the waiters]3855-the waiters were carrying out the comfortable white wicker chairs and arranging them around the marble - topped tables in the shade of [the arcade]1288-the arcade . [They]3855-the waiters were sweeping [the streets]1282-the streets and sprinkling [them]1282-the streets with a hose .

[I]0-rioja alta sat in one of the wicker chairs and leaned back comfortably . [The waiter]447-the waiter was in no hurry to come . The white - paper announcements of the unloading of [the bulls]1281-the bulls and the big schedules of [special trains]2934-special trains were still up on the pillars of [the arcade]1288-the arcade . [A waiter wearing a blue apron]2936-a waiter wearing a blue apron came out with a bucket of water and a cloth , and commenced to tear down the notices , pulling the paper off in strips and washing and rubbing away the paper that stuck to the stone . The fiesta was over .

[I]0-rioja alta drank a coffee and after a while [Bill]240-bill came over . [I]0-rioja alta watched [him]240-bill come walking across [the square]995-the square . [He]240-bill sat down at the table and ordered a coffee .

" Well , "[240-bill] [he]240-bill said , " it 's all over . "[240-bill]

" Yes , "[0-rioja alta] [I]0-rioja alta said . " When do [you]240-bill go ? "[0-rioja alta]

" [I]240-bill do n't know . [We]4460-we better get [a car]3481-a car , [I]240-bill think . Are n't [you]240-bill going back to [Paris]9-paris ? "[240-bill]

" No . [I]0-rioja alta can stay away another week . [I]0-rioja alta think [I]0-rioja alta 'll go to [San Sebastian]78-san sebastian . "[0-rioja alta]

" [I]240-bill want to get back . "[240-bill]

[We]2938-we had lunch and paid the bill . [Montoya]260-montoya did not come near [us]2938-we . [One of [the maids]2940-the maids]2939-one of the maids brought the bill . It did not seem like a very long ride . [Mike]219-mike had a bottle of Fundador . [I]0-rioja alta only took a couple of drinks . [We]2938-we came over [the mountains]1027-the mountains and out of [Spain]23-spain and down [the white roads]2949-the white roads and through [the overfoliaged , wet , green , Basque country]2950-the overfoliaged , wet , green , basque country , and finally into [Bayonne]101-bayonne . " What shall [we]2938-we do about [the car]581-the car ? "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill asked .

" [Old Mike]219-mike [the spender]4468-the spender , "[240-bill] [Bill]240-bill said .

[We]2938-we drove in to [Biarritz]55-biarritz and left [the car]581-the car outside [a very Ritz place]2957-a very ritz place . [We]2938-we went into [the bar]426-the bar and sat on high stools and drank a whiskey and soda .

" That drink 's mine , "[219-mike] [Mike]219-mike said .

" Let 's roll for it . "[2392-the bartender]

So [we]2938-we rolled poker dice out of a deep leather dice - cup . [Bill]240-bill was out first roll . [Mike]219-mike lost to [me]0-rioja alta and handed [the bartender]2392-the bartender a hundred - franc note . The whiskeys were twelve francs apiece . [I]0-rioja alta waded out . The water was cold . As a roller came [I]0-rioja alta dove , swam out under water , and came to the surface with all the chill gone . "[3112-the man who had a matter of two minutes lead in the race]

[The Spaniards]304-the spaniards , [they]3116-they said , did not know how to pedal .

[I]0-rioja alta had coffee out on [the terrasse]3117-the terrasse with [the team manager of one of [the big bicycle manufacturers]3119-the big bicycle manufacturers]3118-the team manager of one of the big bicycle manufacturers .
